189501.name: "Y" is for "Youth"
189501.description:
From publisher blurb:

Super-School Days

Y is for Youth is all about teen heroes and their particular challenges and abilities, and includes things like:

Special origins like Legacy, Sidekick, and Wayward, added on to the regular Icons origins
Teen Qualities & Troubles
Super-School settings and teen-only series
How to include teen heroes and themes in a regular Icons series

189502.name: Bad Penny
189502.description:
From publisher blurb:

Think you've had a bad day? Not yet you haven't, at least not until after Bad Penny's done with you. This probability-manipulator is "muscle" for hire to any enterprising bad guy or organization that can provide her the kicks to go along with the paycheck, and her kicks aren't pretty. Bad Penny isn't satisfied with just beating the opposition ... her ego demands she heap the humiliation all around her.

Bad Penny is a PL 11 enemy to add to your Mutants & Masterminds campaign.

189503.name: Library in between Worlds
189503.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 281st of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a messy library.

The map is 14 x 20 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 4 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2880 pixels in size at 144dpi.

189504.description:
In Звёздные войны: Тайное вторжение (Star Wars: Secret Invasion) you will infiltrate the Death Star to help Princess Leia get out of prison. Players will be confronted by numerous stormtroopers and Darth Vader himself. Luke Skywalker, Han Solo and Obi-Wan Kenobi will come to the rescue.

Звёздные войны: Тайное вторжение, a Star Wars-themed version of Love Letter, is a quick game of luck, determination and deduction. Play character cards, watch out for opponents' actions...and may the Force be with you!

The game is played with only 17 cards. At the beginning of the game, one card is removed at random, then each player draws a card. The game is played in several rounds. Each round represents a stage in the escape plan. At the end of each round, one of the players will get closer to the plan's realization and receive a special token. As soon as someone's got enough tokens, that player will rescue Leia and take her to the Rebel Base.

On their turn, a player draws a card, then plays one of the two cards in hand. Each character card — Princess Leia, Obi-Wan Kenobi, Darth Vader, Luke Skywalker, Chewbacca, C-3PO, R2-D2, Han Solo, Stormtrooper and Boba Fett — has a special ability. In this version of Love Letter, Boba Fett functions the same as a Stormtrooper, with each having the Guard ability of naming a player's role and eliminating them from the round, but with Boba Fett if you miss on the first shot, you can try again. Miss a second time, though, and you're out of the round yourself!

The other difference to regular Love Letter is that the Baron ability is split between the two droids, but with R2-D2, the highest value is out of the round.
189504.name: Love Letter: Star Wars

189505.name: Feats of Divination
189505.description:
From publisher blurb:

The More Feats! PDFs introduce a single page of themed feats for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Every PDF contains a full page of high-quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Feats of Divination includes nine new feats for practitioners of divination magic: Aura Sight, Damning Vision, Divine Beacon, Glimpse of Insight, Insanity Defense, Perceive Enchantments, Rapid Detection, Shrewd Seer, Steady Sight, and Supreme Visionary!

189506.description:
Fallen Angel is a game integrating dice-worker placement and area-majority scoring as its core mechanism, seamlessly matched with a steampunk fantasy theme.

The game is played in four rounds. Every round players take turns placing one or more dice into any of the nine sections on the game board, and execute the associated actions.

Each section is open for multiple visits, even by the same player, and the associated actions can also be performed repeatedly, as long as the dice placement rules are satisfied.

Besides acting as action-workers, dice also help in the competition for VPs. Every three sections are grouped into one “region”. At the end of a round, within each region, a comparison between each player’s number of dice takes place, VPs are then awarded to the winners.
189506.name: Fallen Angel

189508.name: Infected Zombie
189508.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each release for Crawthorne's Catalog of Creatures for the Pathfinder RPG presents a single, new creature for your Pathfinder RPG game, as presented by the famous and retired monster hunter and adventurer, Lord Crawthorne. Each release presents game stats for the new creature, as well as three adventure ideas to help insert them into your game.

The Infected Zombie is the flesh-eating zombie we all know and love from popular media. This is not the vanilla mystically raised from the dead automaton the Pathfinder Role-Playing Game defaults to, nor is it the plague variation that falls short of the genre. This difficult-to-kill zombie has no goal but finding warm flesh to eat, but the true danger comes from the infection its bite can spread. Aiming for the head is also crucial to truly killing these monsters, as you've been hoping for

189509.name: Primeval Thule Campaign Setting (5E)
189509.description:
From publisher blurb:

Primeval Thule 5e is a sword-and-sorcery campaign setting redesigned for 5e

Welcome to Thule, a primordial land of fierce barbarians, elder horrors, and savage wilderness. In this ancient age, humankind is a young race, newly arisen on a monster-haunted Earth. Cities of cruel spledor lie scattered across the great lands of the north like a handful of gems strewn from a dead thief's hand.

This is a doomed age, a time of great deeds and inhuman terror destined to be lost and forgotten beneath the numbing cloak of endless winter. But for one glittering moment, Thule lives—and it is a fierce, cruel, splendid, and marvelous moment indeed.

This 272-page tome provides you everything you need to introduce the world of Thule to your 5e game. Inside, you will find:

A new character race, the Atlanteans;
19 heroic narratives such as free blade, ice reaver, and star-lore adept;
Over 40 new beasts, monsters, and villains to challenge your players;
3 ready-to-play adventures to begin your campaign;
A detailed description of Quodeth, City of Thieves, the perfect home for bold heroes;
A separate PDF of Player Reference Cards to get your players up to speed on characters in Thule;
And a whole continent of savage adventure to explore (map included)!

189510.name: Lord d'Arc
189510.description:
From publisher blurb:

"All shall be safe, and all shall OBEY, under the rule of d'Arc!"

Lord d'Arc is a genius tyrant who believes only under his iron rule can the world survive. A master of science and sorcery, a renowned vampire hunter, and a dedicated ruler of his people, Lord d'Arc is also driven by his need to prove himself superior to Richard Hughes of the Challenger Foundation.

Iconic Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

189511.name: Kite
189511.description:
From publisher blurb:

Carry TWO Big Sticks

Top operative Kite (PL 8) didn’t set out to become a super-agent. Billie-Jeanne Beauchamp wanted to improve the world. She studied hard, earned a PhD, and eventually became a law-enforcement officer. Then, she discovered how much the system doesn’t always treat its representatives equally. Despite facing sexist assignments, Billie uncovered a major operation of the terrorist organization Horde, survived an assassination attempt, and was invited to become a CASTLE agent. She continued to excel and impress, and is now one of Director Nathan Storm's most valued assets.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes you need a character everyone recognizes, even when meeting them for the first time!

189512.name: Veranthea Codex: The Black Knight
189512.description:
From publisher blurb:


"It's Only a Flesh Wound!"

A Pathfinder-compatible adventure for four-five 1st-level characters that includes a brief introduction to each of the continents of Veranthea. See Veranthea Codex for campaign world. As a bonus, each character gets to choose a campaign trait to help blend them into Veranthea!

The Adventure

In a peaceful, idyllic land, the rather humdrum lives of the generous locals is ripped asunder by a local myth: the Black Knight. An item summons this terrifying visage and the PCs recover it! But what to do with it now? It is up to the party to parse the mysterious item, and it's summoned monster, in each of the locations to which they are whisked by the magic of the artifact!

189513.name: Kachit Knights
189513.description:
User summary:
In the game カチットナイト (Kachit Knights), players use 3 knight pawns to capture an opponent's king pawn. The king is initially placed in each player's "base" in the corner of his territory and the knights are held in hand.

Players take turns placing pawns in their own territories (the spaces closest to them). The arrows on the pawns indicate the directions in which they can move. The direction of the arrows can be freely chosen when the pawns are placed. Also, the direction of the arrows can be changed when a pawn is moved.

When the king reaches the central neutral zone, he is flipped to his reverse side to become a knight. If a player's king reaches the enemy's corner base, that player wins, so a good strategy will include attacks and retreats.

(When the game was in development, it was named 'Shooter'.)

Publisher's summary:
3個のナイト駒を使って王様駒を取るゲームです。王様駒は自陣コーナーに
初期配置してナイト駒は持ち駒です。
手番で駒を自陣内（手前スペース）に配置できます。駒の矢印が動ける方向
です。配置時に任意に決められます。また駒が動いた時に矢印の方向を変えられます。
王様駒は中央の中立地帯まで到達すると裏返してナイトの動きも加わります。王様駒が敵陣コーナーに到達しても勝ちなので、攻撃とトライの両方で戦略を組み立てます。

189514.name: Godrem
189514.description:
Godrem is an abstract strategy game created by David A. Madrigal. The game is for 2 or 4 players, and it is set in a fantasy world.

The objective of the game is to conquer the 4 red tiles of the map and take control of the Crystal. The players have 6 army units and 1 Oracle to make it. Every Oracle has different abilities that change the development of the battles and they are the only ones with the power to control the knowledge of the crystal... but not without lose something before.

The first player to take control of the 4 red tiles and the Crystal wins the game.

189515.description:
Designed by John Gorkowski, this series enables players to game historically accurate simulations of tactical operations from the Great War. In the Trenches (ITT) challenges players to move and fight with company-level formations made of separate platoon-sized units during five minute, impulse-based turns. The historically accurate maps are scaled to 100 yards per hex. This approach recreates WWI command and control problems and inspire historically accurate play without forcing decisions.

The second Base Set is a grab-bag of great all-new scenarios. First, the green Americans find themselves in a desperate battle with German stormtroopers. Then, the US 327th Tank Battalion rolls into action at Bois de Sonnard. And finally, because you can never have enough tanks, Mark H. Walker gives us an alt-history engagement to round out the set.

This base set includes all the counters you'll need to play these scenarios, PLUS all the status markers and administrative counters you'll need to play any expansion.

Includes:

176 counters to manouevre
Three 8.5x11-inch maps
1 rulebook to rifle through
1 Player Aid Card and Scenario Card
1 Game Turn Track




(source: Tiny Battle Publishing website)
189515.name: In the Trenches: Doughboys

189516.name: House of Bards
rpgseries: A World of Adventure for Fate Core System
189516.description:
From publisher blurb:

In House of Bards, the kingdom of Costracinni exists in a constant state of war. And war means turmoil, but for the ambitious back on the home front, that’s just another word for opportunity. Can you work the backrooms and stuff the ballot-boxes to get what you want? Play as an ambitious elven councilmember trying to get in good with the Emperor, an idealistic halfling candidate trying to break into the big time, or a human reporter trying to uncover the truth behind the news.

Now is the time to act! But many things stand in your way—rival factions, scheming politicos, and most dangerously… your friends. Swords and sorcery collide with politics and punditry in this political drama meets high fantasy by Dave Chalker of Critical-Hits.com and the Cortex Plus Hacker’s Guide.

House of Bards requires Fate Core to play. This 44-page supplement includes:

Character creation hacks that maximize political conflict, including a random generation system
Skill set adjustments that maximize Fate for a politically motivated campaign
Setting rules that help to create political intrigue and build upon it through the course of a campaign
Useful tools for political campaigns, including a social stress track and new rules for player-versus-player compels
A series of vignettes and sample characters to help get you started




Welcome to the House of Bards, where it’s always important to watch your back.

189517.description:
Welcome, bugs of the forest! This is the Centipede speaking, right from Racing Track. Today, on this sunny morning, I will be your host in this exciting new edition of the Spring Race!

This celebration pits the fastest, smartest and strongest amongst the denizens of the forest in an exciting race to be the 1st to cross the finish line. In order to win, contestants will have to use their wit, brawn and even the help of mighty allies!

So with the contestants already on their starting positions, let the countdown begin...3,2,1...or as we say:

'RUN, BUG, RUN!!!'

In “Run, Bug, Run!” players will compete to be the fastest bug in the yearly Spring Race. Each bug has different attributes and abilities, enabling different strategies in order to be the 1st one to cross the finish line. To do so, players will have to be faster than the others and spend wisely the leaves they gather on race cards, direct attacks and mighty special abilities. In addition, they can opt to check surprise locations, where they can earn extra powerful cards…or be awarded penalties for their avarice
189517.name: Run, Bug, Run!

189518.name: Destiny of Kings
189518.description:
From the publisher's site:

The Destiny of Kings is a campaign supplement for the fantasy mass combat game Kings of War. A copy of Kings of War is required to use this book.

Within this 64 page softback book you will find:

Map-based Campaigns
Narrative Campaigns
The Quest of the Necromancer Campaign
New Heroes

Mortibris the Necromancer cursed and spat in the dust as he saw the host which awaited them. Leave it to the Elves to meddle in matters which did not concern them. With the Dwarfs and possibly the Basileans soon to be at his back, he could ill-afford further distractions here. No matter. The Elves facing him had no idea of the power he could unleash. Not even the blighted maiden at their head, whose essence he recognised readily enough… Madriga!

189519.name: Troll! (Issue 1 - Oct 2008)
189519.description:
From the intro:

Welcome to the first issue of the Troll! fanzine - a zine for laid back gamers. This project started as random talks about wanting to “give something back” to the community in the chatrooms of Dragonsfoot (www.dragonsfoot.org, the 1st edition AD&D site all the contributors to the project hang out at) and soon we had a load of material to publish.

We also had a lazy editor in chief that needed to be whipped by the contributors into doing anything productive. We also had an editor in chief who stole the batteries from his bluetooth mouse to his Wiimote (because there was beer to be drinkked and Tiger Woods to be played) and used that as an excuse for delays.

The issue is named “Summer 08” even though it is already october. But we don’t care, it’s still summer to us, damnit!!!” or something. Anyway...

189520.name: Politisk ukorrekt
189520.description:
A party Game for tolerant people with black humour.

Norway's own "version" of Cards Against Humanity.

What is OK to say? What is not OK at all?
Can we joke about anything? Or are there still taboos within your friend-circle?
The demand of being PC is spreading everywhere, also in Norway. Is this a damper on freedom of speach?
Play Politisk ukorrekt (political incorrect) and test your own tolerance.

In Politsk ukorrekt the question cards are white, and the answer cards have 3 colours: bink, light blue and yellow.
all players start with 4 cards of each colour, and at all times have 12 coloured cards in their hand, but which colours might change.

One player starts as judge, draws a white card and reads it out loud. The other players now have to find the coloured card that best fits into the sentence or as an answer to the question.
The cards are shuffled so the judge doesn't know who handed which card in. Whilst you're judge, you can use your time to get rid of a card from your hand and swap it for a new one.
When everyone has handed in cards and they have been shuffled, the judge read them out loud along with the white card, then choose which is the funniest/best suited.
The winning player gets the white card.
First player to 5 white cards win the game.

189521.name: Troll! (Issue 2 - Oct 2008)
189521.description:
From the intro:

Halloween...

The holiday of costume parties and using the anonymity provided by a Batman costume to ogle and grope a Marilyn while watching a drunk John Wayne vomit in his ten gallon hat. The holiday of kids trick & treating. The holiday of watching a bucketload of horror movies. And a good holiday to run some horror themed role-playing scenarios.

We here at the Troll! offices - if a chatroom can really be called an office - figured that a halloween issue should be in order. To throw some horror themed things into the wild, wild web. I’m not going to waste yer time with more of my ramblings and without further and without further ado, let me present you with the second issue of the Troll! fanzine.

189522.name: Troll! (Issue 3 - May 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Character Generation Guidelines for Lord of the Rings Adventure Game
rpg: Lord of the Rings Adventure Game
189522.description:
From the cover:

INSIDE THIS ISSUE:
MARTIAL ARTS FOR DARK SUN,
ARTICLE ON CHARACTER GENERATION
FOR LORD OF THE RINGS ADVENTURE
GAME, AN ARTIFACT, A
CAMPAIGN WORLD CONCEPT &
OUR FIRST BEER COLUMN!

189523.name: Adventure Shorts, Volume Three
189523.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure shorts volume three is series of five short encounters, written for the fifth edition of the world's most popular roleplaying game. They can be played as stand-alone encounters or dropped into an existing adventure or campaign and are meant to last for about a one-hour gaming session. As in some of our other titles we’re providing balanced encounters and treasure for a party of five characters of levels two, four and six.

The encounters include monsters, traps, obstacles, secret codes, and treasure to challenge your fifth edition players. We’ve also included printer-friendly maps that can be used to set up your own player grids. The encounter titles are as follows:

Arcane Pillar: Reading the magic writing on a strange stone pillar in the woods has some unexpected results.
Carpath Brothers: The mausoleum of two long-dead evil brothers may still have secrets to yield.
The Fog: After entering a dense fog, the adventurers discover the temple of a goddess.
The Scribe: A simple scribe, on his way home for the evening, is attacked as he nears his cottage. He carries a small, interesting key around his neck.
Young Beggar: The adventurers have a chance help someone in need. But there’s more to this young beggar than meets the eye.

189525.name: All of Time and Space Volume 1
189525.description:
From publisher blurb:

All of Time and Space Volume 1 is the first collection of scenarios for Doctor Who Roleplaying Game. This 96 page, full colour hardback provides a convenient collection of four high quality Doctor Who scenarios so that you and your players can dive right into the adventure!

"I am not a bad man. I am not a hero. And I'm definitely not a president. And no, I'm not an officer. Do you know what I am? I am an idiot, with a box and a screwdriver. Just passing through, helping out, learning. I don't need an army. I never have, because I've got them. Always them.”

All of Time and Space Volume 1 takes the Doctor and his companions to strange new lands and into conflict with even stranger alien foes. From alien artefacts in the Tomb of Cleopatra to ghosts in the tunnels beneath Victorian London, from silver rats and strange plagues in Elizabethan England to a mysterious space station straddling parallel universes, adventure is never far away when you’re the Doctor and his companions!

189526.name: Exemplars & Eidolons
189526.description:
Publisher's description:

Tales of Thundering Heroism

Welcome to Exemplars & Eidolons. Within these few pages you’ll find a game of titanic heroes and glorious paragons, living legends of every stripe banding together to accomplish deeds of deathless fame. Using the basic framework of classic old-school gaming you’ll fashion fresh exemplars of daring to battle foes far beyond the compass of ordinary adventurers!

Though actually...

Exemplars & Eidolons is a fully-playable OSR mini-game of high-powered legendary adventurers. But what I really wrote it to be is a simple layout template for other people who'd like to echo the old "Little Brown Books" style of old-school game pamphlets. As the principles of page design are a lot easier to explain with actual game text, I wrote the game so I could have something to lay out for you.

In this download, you'll get the game itself in two versions- one with no Commentary layer for the convenience of people using certain tablet readers, and one with a layer you can turn on via Adobe Reader to see the page design tricks and principles I used to put the pamphlet together. I've also included InDesign source files for the game, and an .IDML InDesign markup language file that should be readable by Scribus. You are encouraged to loot the styles and page objects for your own creations, whether free or commercial.

The art used in the game is also included, and was drawn from the Spears of the Dawn Art Pack and the Scarlet Heroes Art Pack, both of which are free for commercial use and available here on DTRPG.

Those who'd like to see how their own final product might look can order the print version of the pamphlet as well. While it's listed as being a premium color product, it's largely black and white- I prepared it that way so you could see what the paper and color quality was like for your own project before you got too far into the design.

So go forth and make awesome things to share with other people.

189527.name: Mutant Chronicles Players' Guide
189527.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mutant Chronicles Players' Guide is an essential companion for Mutant Chronicles players and uses content drawn from the 3rd Edition Core Rulebook. It contains everything players need to create characters in the Mutant Chronicles universe, beautiful full color illustrations which bring the dark game world to life, as well as an introduction to the 2d20 game system.

Inside this lavish 116 page full colour edition, you'll discover:

Full character generation system with point buy or random life path options,based on a character’s Faction, Status, Environment, Education and Careers
Detailed Skills and Talents chapter for in-game reference.
Character Sheets (including Lifepath worksheet).
Short and Long term experience and gameplay rewards.
Introduction to the 2d20 game system, including combat and rules for cinematic roleplaying.
How to use Momentum and Chronicle Points to boost your game.
Weapon and armour tables to get your character ready for action.
Overview of the Mutant Chronicles universe and factions including faction relationships.

189528.name: AXYOS
189528.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




AXYOS is for those who are looking for a combination of MOBA and FPS genres. When leading your team to win, you shouldn't only be an accurate shooter, but additionally, play tactically by using support items and wisely upgrading your character during a gaming session!

Source: The Developer Website.

189529.name: Het Westfrieslandspel
189529.description:
A board game with questions in 6 categories about the region West Friesland in The Netherlands.
During the game your goal is to collect the 5 name tags of the big cities and to collect 2 lions.
These can be collected by answering the questions correctly at some locations on the board.
Every turn you roll with the dice and answer questions untill you answered a question incorrect or you received 1 of the 7 goal tags.

189530.name: Curious Characters Deck
189530.description:
From the back of the box:

A range of friends and foes, with game characteristics and backstories, providing additional NPCs and replacement investigators (48 cards).

Call of Cthulhu Keeper Decks are designed to provide in game [sic] resources, handy references, and information. Use these decks to supplement scenarios, for inspiration when designing new encounters, to pass secret and important notes to players, and as a handy way to impart information. These decks can add new layers to plots, enhance the story, as well as [sic] introduce friendly or villainous non-player characters. Other decks in the series include: The Phobia Deck, The Unfortunate Events Deck, and The Weapons And Artifacts Deck.

189531.name: The Phobia Deck
189531.description:
From the back of the box:

Detailing the effects of phobias, manias, or episode [sic] of madness, each card describes and advises on the consequences of investigator insanity (48 cards).

Call of Cthulhu Keeper Decks are designed to provide in game [sic] resources, handy references, and information. Use these decks to supplement scenarios, for inspiration when designing new encounters, to pass secret and important notes to players, and as a handy way to impart information. These decks can add new layers to plots, enhance the story, as well as [sic] introduce friendly or villainous non-player characters. Other decks in the series include: The Curious Characters Deck, The Unfortunate Events Deck, and The Weapons And Artifacts Deck.

189532.name: War Fleet
boardgamefamily: Victory By Any Means Campaign Series
189532.description: War Fleet is a block game designed for massive fleets of starships to battle and still be resolved in a reasonable amount of time. The design focuses on admiral level decisions, such as fleet position, command, and starship configuration. It also allows for variable levels of complexity and could easily be expanded to fit a number of settings. The map covers a vast amount of space which can be everything from a large section of deep space to a lone star system. It is designed to work independently or within a Victory by Any Means campaign game

189534.name: The Unfortunate Events Deck
189534.description:
From the back of the box:

All manner of strange, ill-fated, and disastrous situations that can affect, hinder, and trouble your investigators. Use in game [sic] to add additional drama and upsets for your investigators (48 cards).

Call of Cthulhu Keeper Decks are designed to provide in game [sic] resources, handy references, and information. Use these decks to supplement scenarios, for inspiration when designing new encounters, to pass secret and important notes to players, and as a handy way to impart information. These decks can add new layers to plots, enhance the story, as well as [sic] introduce friendly or villainous non-player characters. Other decks in the series include: The Curious Characters Deck, The Phobia Deck, and The Weapons And Artifacts Deck.

189535.name: The Weapons and Artifacts Deck
189535.description:
From the back of the box:

Detailing hand-to-hand melee weapons, firearms, and Cthulhu Mythos artifacts. Each card describes the weapon's game statistics, as well as supporting historical information (48 cards).

Call of Cthulhu Keeper Decks are designed to provide in game [sic] resources, handy references, and information. Use these decks to supplement scenarios, for inspiration when designing new encounters, to pass secret and important notes to players, and as a handy way to impart information. These decks can add new layers to plots, enhance the story, as well as [sic] introduce friendly or villainous non-player characters. Other decks in the series include: The Curious Characters Deck, The Phobia Deck, and The Unfortunate Events Deck.

189537.name: The Marriage of Count Roderick
189537.description:
Publisher blurb:

Count Roderick seeks a bride. At the request of one of Roderick’s leading diplomats, the Player-knights join a delegation that travels on the Count’s behalf to interview eligible heiresses of Logres. What can the Player-knights learn on these errands? When Count Roderick seeks their impressions, what will they report? Over the course of these years Player-knights may witness the birth of the feud between Count Roderick of Salisbury and Sir Blains, the Steward of Levcomagus, a rival suitor to the hand of Lady Ellen of Wynchbank.

Each part of this free multi-part scenario is designed to be an incidental episode that ought not take more than fifteen minutes to play — that is, it’s not the main scenario of the year but rather a short event that occurs before or after the main activity of the year. These scenarios illustrate how marriages are typically arranged amongst the nobility in King Arthur Pendragon and provide an example of how to play a visit to a court other than the Player-knights’ own. They also offer insights into the infamous rivalry between Salisbury and Levcomagus.

189538.name: Decipher
189538.description: Each player chooses a 5-letter word and then places the remanning letter tiles of the alphabet in order on a numbered grid. On their turn they ask and are told the letter on a specific number, enabling them to deduce clues about the letters "missing". They get one guess of opponent's word at beginning of each turn.

189539.description:
Cards Against Humanity Zelph On The Shelf Edition is a fan-made version of Cards Against Humanity that is designed for ex-Mormon players. Like the regular game, a player selects a black card with fill in the blank text and each player selects one of their white cards to try and find the funniest result. The person playing the black card chooses the funniest response.

This game pokes fun at Mormonism and Mormon Apologetics. The name Zelph refers to a skeleton found by Joseph Smith in Illinois that was uncovered in a Native American mound. He claimed the bones belonged to a warrior named Zelph who had fought in the battles described in the Book of Mormon.

The game can be played independently or integrated with Cards Against Humanity. Like the original game, the humor is very adult in nature and is recommended for mature players. For faithful Mormons, the game is probably especially offensive.
189539.name: Zelph On The Shelf Edition (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)

189540.description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 9.
Also a promo for Spiel 2016.

The first player who fills his 6-space Enclosure takes the enclosure with the Skunk as a bonus.

Once per game, If it is the owners turn he can pay 2 coins to discard all tiles of one animal type from his barn as an additional action before or after his usual action. The player puts the coins on the Skunk enclosure and they remain there until the end of the game. In turn order, all other players may then pay 1 coin to the bank to purchase 1 of the discarded tiles and add it to their zoo. The tiles that were not purchased are removed from the game.
Scoring: The coins on the Skunk enclosure are not considered during scoring
189540.name: Zooloretto: Skunk

189542.name: Graphical Galaxy Sector Map #1
189542.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

This is a hiRes Hex map for use with sci fi games such as Traveller & Stars Without number. You can print it out & fill by hand, but I've taken the time to make it a FORM FILLABLE PDF. Yup I said it..

Its totally form fillable, all 80 hex's with 22 additional boxes for any additional text you may want to write in for your sector. Thats 102 space to write in & maintain easily visable text as well.

189544.name: Form Fillable Planetary Readout
189544.description:
User Summary --

A coloured graphic planetary sheet, with a very sci-fi look and feel, which has boxes of to the sides for planetary information to be entered onto the PDF itself for printing.

189545.name: Atomic the Card Game
189545.description:
Atomic the card game is a "build and explode" game for 2-5 players, ages 10+. It's based on Chemistry, but don't worry, you won't learn anything.

Gather your Elements. Stick them together with Bonds. Trigger reactions with Catalysts! If your opponents try to stop you with Water, soak it up with a Sponge! Then throw a little Anti-Matter at them and change up the game with a devious Experiment or two!

189547.name: Subterranean Prison
189547.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

I'm starting a program where I will try to make a brand new dungeon every single day!!

The Subterranean prison is grided and has 2 variations, its "like new" condition & a ruined verson. The highres JPG's are included & pre-formated for 8x11 landscape @ 300DPI

RE-Made!!

It was brought to my attention that the grid was slightly off so I revisited both versions of the prison and remade them so that the grid is 100% perfect throught the subterainean prison as well as having a different pattern for the "dugout" tunnels in the prisons ruined version.

189548.name: Storm Battalion
189548.description:
Publisher blurb:

In the year 1935, a strange, devastating storm unlike any other touched down on Canadian soil, blighting the land, mutating animals and granting disturbing supernatural powers to people who died within its energies. This was only the first of many such storms. Terrible wars ignited, channelling the predatory abilities of those changed, called Risen, and the miraculous technology made possible by using harnessed Storm energy as a power source.

The British use their fantastic new science to keep their subjugated Canadian citizens in line and protected from the encroaching forces of the United States and the independent nation of Indigenous people, the Kegintági. The European Union became mercenaries, lending their fleet of airships and impressive firepower to the highest bidder and using payment to buy and hoard Storm technology. The underground Canadian army fills their ranks with undying soldiers with horrifying powers and use relentless guerilla warfare in an attempt to overthrow their oppressors by any means necessary.

The warring countries create speciality squads comprised of mutated soldiers with wondrous powers and send them into the most dangerous situations possible. Players are a part of one of these "Storm Battalions" as they try to combat the threats to their country and stay human in a brave new world of monsters and warfare.

Welcome to the new front lines.

This book includes:


History of this strange alternative earth



A guide for creating new characters (human and their twisted counterparts)



All the rules needed to play, powered by the Dynamic Gaming System



A roster of heroes and villains alike, statistics of foes both large and small



Three adventures that range in levels of danger.

189550.name: Supercave
189550.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

I'm starting a program where I will try to make a brand new dungeon every single day!!

The Supercave is grided and sprawls over almost the entirety of the page. There are multiple levels of elevation within the cave to torture your players. The highres JPG is included & pre-formated for 8x11 @ 300DPI print

189551.name: My Private Mine
189551.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

I'm starting a program where I will try to make a brand new dungeon every single day!!

My private mine is grided and sprawls over almost the entirety of the page. The map is of a subterranean estate with its own private mining caves that lead off map. Possibly leading into one of the other Dungeon a Day maps, such as the supercave. Included are 3 highres JPG's pre-formated for 8x11 @ 300DPI print

The maps are a standard Black & White, BluePrint style & a printer friendly grayscale if you want to save on ink when printing the map.

189552.name: Starship Deathtrap
189552.description:
Stuck on a dying world, a handful of people take their only chance at survival, a junked space ship. All they need to do is keep it together and working to reach their new home. How hard can that be?

Starship Deathtrap is a cooperative game that can be played solo or up to 5 players. Players will control the movements and actions of one or more of the 5 crew members, each having their own unique expertise.

With the ship starting damaged, the crew is already behind. Each turn consists of 4 phases: Crew phase, disasters spread phase, new disaster phase, and advancement phase.

Crew Phase: Each crew member uses their allotted actions to move, activate ships systems, or fight disasters.

Disaster Phase: Any unstopped disasters will spread causing more problems for the crew.

New Disaster Phase: Each turn a new disaster will be determined (where and what type) randomly by a die roll.

Advancement Phase: Advance your energy level and distance to destination meter.

189553.name: Mini Mining Camp
189553.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

Maybe the owners of this small mine got too greedy, maybe they dug too deeply... Unabashed greed can leed you down such a long dark path. Lets find out where that path ends. .

I'm starting a program where I will try to make a brand new dungeon every single day!!

The Mini Mining Camp is grided and has 2 variations, One with the rooms numbered to make adventure generation easy & one version without the numbers to just enjoy the map. The highres JPG's are included & pre-formated for 8x11 landscape @ 300DPI

189554.name: The Endeavour
189554.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

Another Day, Another dungeon!

The Endeavour is a grided map of a large space vessel using each grid point as a 10ft square. Or a smaller vessel with the grid at 5ft squares. Great for futuristic games such as Travler or a Sci-Fi themed Cypher system game The highres JPG is included & pre-formated for 8x11 portrait @ 300DPI

189555.name: Rhodes Depot
189555.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

Another Day, Another dungeon!

Rhodes Depot is a very large grided map of a space station. A station meant more for trade and entertainment than anything else. Great for futuristic games such as Travler or a Sci-Fi themed Cypher system game. The highres JPG's included are a square grid and a hex grid & pre-formated for 17x22 portrait @ 300DPI

189556.name: Small Space Elevator & Launching Station
189556.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

Another Day, Another dungeon!

The space elevator & launcging station is a grided map of a planetside to space station elevator & its planetside launching station.

With the idea of a trip from earth to space taking a few days the elevator is built to transport freight supplies and recreational passangers. The top two floors are dedicated to passenger transport while the bottom 3 are for freight, supplies and crew. So that the elevator has somewhere to house it on the surface of whatever planet it goes down to I've included a launching station. It serves the same dual purpose as the elevator.

This map is great for futuristic games such as Travler or a Sci-Fi themed Cypher system game. The highres JPG's included are a square grid and a hex grid & pre-formated for 8.5x11inch portrait @ 300DPI

189557.name: The Lien-Kashi
189557.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

I'm starting a program where I will try to make a brand new dungeon every single day!!

Following along the previous dungeon a day's Ive put out, here is yet another sci-fi map. The Lien-Kashi! A passenger vessel meant for transport & a bit of luxury. Maybe there's a murder mystery that happens aboard the Lien-Kashi, or maybe its taken over and help for ransom by space pirates? The choice of what adventure to run is yours!

The Lien_Kashi comes with both square and hex grids. There six levels this passenger vessel. The highres JPG is included & pre-formated for 8x11 @ 300DPI print

189558.name: Vossler's Labyrinth
189558.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

I'm starting a program where I will try to make a brand new dungeon every single day!!

Some men collect swords, some rare rocks... Vossler collected wealth!!! Once he had much more coin than the local king could ignore, Vossler was made an enemy of the kingdom. Vosslers death, unlike his extravagant life was made most horrific. Vossler left behind wealth unimaginable, but that wealth was hidden deap beneath his manor, hidden behind the twists and turns of his labyrinth.

Vosslers Labyrinth is a simple labyrinth with a few devious twists. I'm keeping the labyrinth small than I normally would to allow it to be solved & mapped by players as they delve deep within it. There are 2 maps to Vossler's labyrinth, the base map & the labyrinth's solution (the most direct route that can solve the labyrinth)

The highres JPG's are included & pre-formated for 8x11 @ 300DPI print

189559.name: Something in the Cellar
189559.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

I'm starting a program where I will try to make a brand new dungeon every single day!!

Most men of means have house that reach both higher and lower than the peasentry. This home is just the sort. Not an entirely extravagent home but one with a large root cellar for aging wines & whisky's. Holding on to meats and various other food stuffs. That was untill however, the cellar was breached by some subteranean creature.

Something in the cellar starts in the home but branched out into an absolutely MASSIVE cave system. Its tunnels and caves reaching throughout the underground like massive dark tendrils. Can your players help the noble or will they die, lost and alone beneath the earth?

The highres JPG is included & pre-formated for 8.5x11 @ 300DPI Ready to print

189560.name: The Tarsoma
189560.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

I'm starting a program where I will try to make a brand new dungeon every single day!!

Another large 2 decked space ship to add to the scfi-fi maps.

The highres JPG is included & pre-formated for 11x8.5 @ 300DPI print

189561.name: Vossler's Mansion
189561.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

I'm starting a program where I will try to make a brand new dungeon every single day!!

Some men collect swords, some rare rocks... Vossler collected wealth!!! Once he had much more coin than the local king could ignore, Vossler was made an enemy of the kingdom. Vosslers death, unlike his extravagant life was made most horrific. Vossler left behind wealth unimaginable, but that wealth was hidden deap beneath his manor, The door to his labyrinth in one of his many rooms.

Vosslers mansion is a simple victorian style home with large rooms and multiple levels of elevation. Will Vossler be entertaining tonight? Or does Vosslers corpse rot in the kings dungeon & his ghost haunt his illustrious home?

The highres JPG is included & pre-formated for 8x11 @ 300DPI print

189562.name: The Sivath
189562.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

I'm starting a program where I will try to make a brand new dungeon every single day!!

The Sivath is a large 5 floored space ship with a small hangar bay housing 2 fighters and a transport shuttle, to add to the growing list scfi-fi maps.

The highres JPG is included & pre-formated for 11x8.5 @ 300DPI print

189563.name: The Callisto Way Station
189563.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

I'm starting a program where I will try to make a brand new dungeon every single day!!

The Callisto ay station is a tiny 3 floored space station with 2 small hangar bay's cappable of housing fighters and a transport shuttle's. The larger airlock is for the docking of larger corvetter class starships. The Callisto exists in the dead of space more for the trade of information than anything esle. Included with the Callisto is a legend containing 8 fighters & 3 shuttles to be used as tokens. To add to the growing list & world of scfi-fi maps.

This as the other scifi dungeon a day maps can be used for systems such as travler, EotE or any other space opera / action adventure you are running.

The highres JPG is included & pre-formated for 11x8.5 @ 300DPI print

189564.name: The Sherwin Tavern & inn
189564.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

The Sherwin tavern and in is an old manor home purchased and re-purposed into what it is today. Maybe its haunted by the old nobles that lived here, there spirits taking lethal action to eject those they feel do not belong?

I don't think I've been offering enough buildings interiors so here it is! You can use this for your games as a large home, estate or an inn. The Sherwin inn comes pre-formatted to be print ready on an 8.5 x 11 inch paper at a resolution of 300 dpi

189565.name: Maehala's Tower
189565.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

The old tower of Maehala the mage, cause we need a mage tower dagnabit!!

I don't think I've been offering enough buildings interiors so here it is! You can use this for your games as a large mage tower, gaurd tower or any tower you'd like. The Maehala's tower comes with two preformated to be print ready images. One with the tower in its ruined state & one that is A.OK. Both images are on an 8.5 x 11 inch paper at a resolution of 300 dpi format as always

189566.name: The Temple of Exiles
189566.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

You didn't think I forgot to make a temple did you? Joining the dungeon a day line is the temple of exiles!

I don't think I've been offering enough buildings interiors so here it is! You can use this for your games as a multi chambered temple, manor home, military installation or whatever you'd like. The temple of exiles is two stories high and has a small gazeabo in its courtyard. The hi-res image is preformated to be print ready@ 8.5 x 11 inch paper at a resolution of 300 dpi format as always

189567.name: The Twisting Tunnels
189567.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

The twisting tunnels has just that! A labyrinth of twisting tunnels snaking over under and around one another and opening up to large multi-tiered caverns. The tunnels have a few "natural" traps and pitfalls built in to the design. The majority of the tunnels are only 5ft (1sq) in width to keep a cramped claustrophobic feel & keep your players fearful of whats behind every coner, twist & turn. The large caverns have multiple levels of "elevation" so that your creatures, or players can make use of, for a more dynamic combat encounter & lets face it.. who doesn't enjoy delving ever deaper into the darkness!

The hi-res image is preformated to be print ready@ 8.5 x 11 inch paper at a resolution of 300 dpi format as always

189568.name: The House on the Hill
189568.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

I'd like to finish this months Dungeon a day with a simple house on a hill. It's not overly large or extravagant, maybe the home of an upper ranking military official. Its a fairly deffensible position, say if the nearby peasant populace decides to revolt. Its also good to run a haunted investigative game in. Maybe the lady of the house threw herself off the balcony? Or maybe the head of the house was killed in a peasants revolt & his ghost is still fighting intruders? As always, the choice is yours.

The hi-res image is preformated to be print ready@ 8.5 x 11 inch paper at a resolution of 300 dpi format as always

189569.name: The Yeti's Cave
189569.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

The Yeti's cave is smaller when compared to other Dungeon a day maps but you players will go around in circles quite a few times, there are also many sloped areas designed to forcefully split the party & inflict minot damage ipon failed balance checks.

Included are 2 maps, the "DRY" & "WET" versions. The wet version adds another dimension of difficulty to the environment by partially and fully submerging some of the lower tunnels.

189570.name: Welcome to Volatis
189570.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

WELCOME TO VOLATIS! Not only a world map but a WORLD!
This is the world of Volatis, included will be several maps of this world done in 3 different styles. The purpose of this map is to be setting agnostic & allow you as a game master to run it using any rules set you wish with settings of your own imagination. This will be the first in what I hope to be a very long line of setting agnostic maps for the community to enjoy.

Being a member of the RPG community & I want to support that community in any way that I can so these maps will be available under a Pay What You Like model. I put a lot of time and effort into this map and hope that its reflected in the final product.

189571.name: Welcome to Iridius
189571.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

Within this PDF you’ll find Irididius and 6 styles of maps. Some maps have settlements to suggest where you can place some of your key cities and towns. Included I also have a “political map” suggesting where the borders between empires may lay.

I still have 100% generic versions of Iridius included in this PDF so that you can populate every corner of this world with your own cities towns & kingdoms

189572.name: Setting Agnostic Maps Collection 1
189572.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

Being a member of the RPG community & I want to support that community in any way that I can so these maps will be available under a Pay What You Like model. I put a lot of time and effort into this map and hope that its reflected in the final product.

189573.name: Generic Worldmaps Vol.2
189573.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

Here is a small collection of different maps designed to be setting & system agnostic. Blank slates to inspire & for you to build your own fantasy worlds and adventures!


Within this PDF you’ll find 3 different world maps done in two different styles. At the end of this PDF is also a bonus map!

The continents have been left unlabeled & there are no

kingdoms, cities or towns. This is so that you can inhabit the worlds as you see fit.

I will be continually coming out with more map packs likes these in the future.

189574.name: Generic World Maps Vol.3
189574.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

Generic world maps volume 3! In this installment I have 1 large world map created in 3 different flavors. A basic color map, sepia map & a politcal map. As usual I have left the lands unlabaled so you can populate the world however you see fit. In the Political map I have divided the lands into political regions based on topography & fun areas of conflict.

The maps full size in 25.5 X 8 inches but hase been divided up for ease of printing.

I've also for the first time implemented a graphical index because clicking on pictures is always more fun than clicking on words.

Included with the PDF are the 3 original Jpg's of the maps

189575.name: The Creeping Dark Episode 1: Terror at Tymore
189575.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

Included:

16 page adventure
3 unique creatures
2 pre made characters
A form fillable characer sheet
several maps
& more

This is the first adventure packet that I’m writing for the 13th age roleplaying game system and is intended to be a suppliment to add to your game world. The 13th age roleplaying game core rule book is required for the full experience. Included will be a pair of premade characters, unique creatures and locations as well as the first in a series of the “ Creeping Dark” encounters.

The geographic location of the township of Tymore, its surrounding farms & the Sahasi guild are not stipulated to allow them to be slotted anywhere in your gaming world.

You are the GM and of course the world is yours & your players to shape. Feel free to follow the guidelines or use them merely as inspiration to craft your own stories.

Though this is written & intended to be run using the 13th age roleplaying game, the contents herein are easily compatible with many D20 products.

189576.name: Drop in Adventures: Dwarven Temple
189576.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

Any rules set you like, any setting you like, run your players through the dwarven temple and watch them squirm.. beg.. and plea for their characters lives!
The first in a line of simple rules agnostic drop in adventures. To be used as a one shot or as a sidequest to an existing campaign.

This is themed on an that old style of RPG that toyed with your players and punished them for their mistakes. The monsters and traps are sugggested rather than stipulated but the pain and anguish that will follow... is garaunteed!!

ENJOY!

189577.name: Drop in Adventures: Masacre at the Mine
189577.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

Any rules set you like, any setting you like, run your players through the masacre at the mine and watch them squirm.. beg.. and plea for their characters lives! Marvel at their descent into madness as they try & try to solve puzzle at this adventures very core!
The secondin a line of simple rules agnostic drop in adventures. To be used as a one shot or as a sidequest to an existing campaign.

This is themed on an that old style of RPG that toyed with your players and punished them for their mistakes. The monsters and traps are sugggested rather than stipulated but the pain and anguish that will follow... is garaunteed!!

The masacre at the mine has 3 interlinked puzzles that will drive your players insane! They are constructed with multiple layers of clues & misdirection but still solvable and intimately woven into the adventures narrative.

189578.name: Fall of the Titanic
189578.description:
User Summary

Set foot aboard the Titanic, exploring the ship deck for deck. Discover what the layout, structure and purpose of the ship was like in 1912.

189579.name: Statues
189579.description:
User Summary

You awake in a hospital and explore around looking for an exit and answers to questions. Pursuing you are evil creatures who only move when you are not looking at them.

189580.name: Age of Survival
189580.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

You try to survive in a jungle island off the coast of Africa, crafting and exploring to survive.

189581.name: Blackfaun
189581.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Blackfaun is a fast paced roguelike with RPG elements, featuring challenging combat and replayability. Players join a faun tasked with a mysterious quest to prove her worth as heiress to the crown. Vibrant colors and a rich soundtrack bring dungeons to life for a fully immersive experience.

Source: The Game Website.

189582.name: Alternate Origins
189582.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

In The Strange, characters frequently change as they travel from recursion to recursion. A Stealthy vector who is Licensed to Carry on Earth might become, through the process of translation to a fantasy-like recursion such as Ardeyn, a Stealthy vector who Slays Dragons. Or a Stealthy vector who Integrates Weaponry in a recursion where mad science is a natural law.

But what if your character isn't from Earth? What if she came here from one of those recursions—or what if your campaign is set in Earth's shoals, in places where the characters don't even know Earth exists? What if you just want even more flexibility in how characters translate in your campaign?

Alternate Origins introduces 15 new descriptors for characters not from Earth. A Vampire vector who is Licensed to Carry? A Halfling or a Grey spinner? How about a Rebel, or a Mutant paradox? New worlds of choices open up to your characters when they have Alternate Origins!

189583.name: Impossible Vehicles
189583.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

Recursions within the Strange are seeded by fiction, imagination, and myth—stories. And stories sometimes feature vehicles, often vehicles that are practically iconic to their settings. Star fighters. Flying carpets. The Argo. Vehicles large enough to host the PCs through the bulk of their adventures are especially likely to be seeded into the Strange.

This fractal brings you a sampling of vehicles presented as artifacts, both minor and major. Of course, any time characters ride in vehicles, there’s a chance for a chase or a fight, so we’ve also included rules for vehicle combat.

189584.name: Strange Revelations: Ten Instant Adventures for The Strange
189584.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

Horror, Action, and Mystery in the Shoals of Earth!

What’s the hardest part of running a roleplaying game? It has to be the preparation. You can’t just spontaneously say, “Let’s play a roleplaying game” unless someone’s already spent hours preparing an adventure for the group. But what if running a great game didn’t require any more effort for the game master than it does for the players? What if you could get up and running in—literally—just five minutes?

Strange Revelations makes prepping for an RPG no more difficult or time consuming than setting up a board game, while showcasing the wonder and weirdness of the many recursions lying in the Shoals of Earth. This is a must-have for beginning and veteran GMs of The Strange.

These aren’t adventure seeds—they’re complete adventures in an innovative format that requires minimal prep. Run them as one-shots or drop them into your ongoing campaign when you don’t have time to prep your own adventures. You can even run them together as a campaign for months of effortless play!

Strange Revelations includes:

--*Ten adventures on Earth and across numerous recursions, complete with maps, NPCs, and all the details you expect.

--*An innovative format for adventures: five minutes of prep gets you started, with no need to read pages and pages of text in advance.

--*An escape from a post-apocalyptic cannibal wasteland, a horror-themed board game that exerts bizarre powers over its players, a medieval wardrobe that opens into a hellish realm, and much, much more.

--*Great advice on running adventures with little or no prep.

--*Beautiful, full-color Show ’Em illustrations to reveal to players during the adventures.

--*Six pregenerated characters that get you playing in minutes.

--*A handy rules cheat sheet to make things run even more smoothly.

Protect Earth from a malefic Lovecraftian entity. Search for salvage on a derelict spacecraft. Set off into the dark energy of the Strange itself to defend the Orb of Worlds. Strange Revelations is a must-have for beginning and veteran GMs of The Strange, and anyone who’d like to play RPGs as easily and spontaneously as board games!

189585.name: The Nightcraft
189585.description:
Blurb From Publisher --

A Ride Into the Night

Aeon Priests speculate that at some time in the distant past, the Earth was the hub of an empire that spanned the vastness of space. At such a time in the dim recesses of the prior worlds, numenera craft of all varieties crossed the gulfs and came here, or flew from Earth out into the night. Some of these craft remain in the Ninth World, lost deep within ancient ruins, buried beneath the ground, or submerged under the sea.

The Nightcraft, as it is called, is one such vehicle. Although its existence is not well known, a few numenera experts have long speculated that the ship can be used to travel into the void beyond the edges of the world. And they are right.

Mentioned in Into the Night, the Nightcraft is ideally suited to serve as a vessel and base of operations for midnight pilgrims. This supplement focuses on that vessel, giving you more details on its design and contents, new maps and illustrations, and ideas for using the Nightcraft in your campaign.

189586.name: No Safe Harbor: The Raid on Darwin
189586.description:
From the rules:

"No Safe Harbor is a simulation wargame about the Japanese raids on Darwin Harbor on February 19, 1942.The game is meant for two players, with one player taking on the role of the Japanese attackers and the other the Australian defense forces. The game can easily be played solitaire, however."

The winner has the most victory which are gained differently by each player. The Australian player gains points by eliminating Japanese units and escaping with their naval units, while the Japanese player wins by bombing Darwin and sinking the naval units.

189587.name: Ke-Thaarn
189587.description:
Dall'introduzione:
Ke-Thaarn è un universo a parte, un gigantesco cerchio di foresta sulla quale fluttuano tre città volanti un tempo abitate da creature misteriose.

Questo speciale è diviso in due parti: la prima descrive l’ambientazione e la storia di Ke-Thaarn; la seconda è invece un’avventura per 4-6 personaggi di livello compreso tra il quarto ed il sesto.

L’ambientazione e l’avventura sono la traduzione italiana di un articolo tratto da Casus Belli[/rpgperiodical] n. 107.

From the foeword (English translation):
Ke-Thaarn is an universe apart, a giant forest circle: upon it three flying cities, formerly inhabitated by mysterious creatures, are floating.

This special issue is split into two parts: part one describes Ke-Thaarn setting and history; part two is an adventure for 4-6 characters, level 4-6.

The whole issue is the Italian translation of an article formerly published on Casus Belli[/rpgperiodical] #107.

189588.name: Orchi
189588.description:
User summary:"
An Orc-only special issue, including two adventures, a Warhammer fantasy scenario and several articles on greenskins in gaming and media.

189589.name: iCubo
189589.description:
The objective of iCubo is to solve puzzles in the shape of cubes in the minor leasttime. The game includes an hourglass, cards of different values with which to pay for time and to see of one and in order of numeration 7 tracks that will help you to arm the iCubo; and the most incredible thing: 10 iCubos that generate 5 iCubos multicolored too, shaping a real game of revolutionary ingenuity in construction 3D. The game begins the hourglass is turned, which gives 5 minutes to solve the iCubo. From there, everything depends on you and the strategy that you use.

El Objetivo del Juego es armar rompecabezas en forma de cubos en el menor tiempo posible, donde podrán jugar hasta 4 jugadores. El juego cuenta con un reloj de arena, fichas de diferentes valores con las cuales pagar por tiempo y para ver de a una y en orden de numeración las 7 pistas que te ayudarán a armar el iCubo; y lo más increíble: 10 iCubos que generan a su vez 5 iCubos multicolor, conformando un verdadero juego de ingenio revolucionario en construcción 3D. El juego comienza cuando damos vuelta el reloj, contando con 5 minutos para armar el iCubo. A partir de allí, todo depende de vos y la estrategia que utilices para desplegar toda su capacidad.

189590.name: Black Spiral Vortices
189590.description:
From publisher blurb:

Black Spiral Vortices is a unique setting expansion for Glimpse the Beyond, which examines options for an expanded, futuristic version of the galaxy. Black Spiral Vortices introduces a possible future for the world of Glimpse the Beyond, in which humanity has discovered the true nature of the supernatural through expanded exploration. Set in the year 2216, this supplement looks at a human race that has prospered through technological advancement and survived supernatural strife. Civilization as we know it in the 21st Century is a distant memory, and the Magi, once hidden from humanity, have risen to cultural prominence. No longer concerned with keeping their fellow humans in the dark about the supernatural, Magi now stand side by side with engineers and astrophysicists, using their knowledge to shape the future. Science and Magick have found a way to coexist in this world, by merging into the new practice known as Metateck, for the betterment and expansion of humanity throughout the cosmos.

Black Spiral Vortices examines how new technologies and magickal revelations have reshaped the universe and expanded humanity’s role within it. The rules and materials herein are designed to explore a dark, yet hopeful future, far removed from the “world outside your window” presented in the core rulebook. This possible future is painted in broad strokes, leaving many of the specific details up to the Guide to determine. New setting elements and systems will be introduced which have been designed with the interstellar setting of Black Spiral Vortices in mind. Having said that, some Guides may wish to cherry pick certain elements from this book for use in a standard Glimpse the Beyond campaign, while ignoring other elements. Such is the prerogative of the individual Guide. It’s your game. Keep what you like and discard the rest.

Black Spiral Vortices includes:

Alternate Character Creation Rules: an expanded rule set that allows players to draw up mundane humans, Magi, technomagickal Metaphysicists, or supernatural creatures as playable characters.
New Boons, Flaws, and Skills: Boons, flaws, and skills specifically designed for use in the Black Spiral Vortices setting.
Alternate Ritual Magick Rules: the Black Spiral Vortices setting is a futuristic environment. As such, Ritual Magick works a bit differently than in the core setting. Furthermore, Black Spiral Vortices introduces a new type of technological magick called Metaphysicks, and the rules for implementing this potent tool.
Locations: a brief overview several human colonies, both within the Earth solar system and beyond! Take to the stars with Black Spiral Vortices.

189591.name: Terrors of Egypt
189591.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beware the beat of the cloth-wrapped feet!

From the Old Kingdoms to the modern day, the dark magic of ancient Egypt comes to life in five blood-chilling tales of vengeful mummies and curses that destroy the greedy. The center piece of Terrors of Egypt is Alan Hewetson and Cesar Lopez's tale of the mysterious and bewitching Khefra, collected here for the first time anywhere, but the other stories are also sure to haunt your imagination long after you've put the book down.

In addition to the comics, Terrors of Egypt contains an expansion to character generation that can be used in any d20 System game that, with inspriation from the Zodiac of ancient Egypt, can bring additional flavor and color to player characters.

189592.name: Medieval Hunter's Cabin
189592.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 32 x 20 inch, full color battlemap of a Medieval Hunter's Cabin.

The Product comes with the Square, Hex and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps (VTT).

“I don’t know anything about murdered sheep. Sheep are unworthy animals for a hunting man to slaughter and their hide is worthless for tanning.”—The Lone Huntsman

Medieval Hunter’s Cabin is a single level map of the interior of a wooden cabin and porch surrounded by an exterior plains clearing in the middle of a forest.

Medieval Hunter’s Cabin is intended for use in fantasy or medieval historical era games. It is also useful in fairy tale and horror games.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

The Lone Huntsman: A wandering shepherd has found his flock ripped to shreds and over half his sheep dead, gutted by a large wild dog or wolf. The shepherd offers the group what little he has, sheep’s milk, the meat of the slaughtered animals, and wool for winter clothes if the group will help him hunt down the slayer. The spoor of the creature’s tracks leads to the woods of a huntsman who lives alone.

The huntsman claims to have seen no dog or wolf. Curiously, the huntsman does not own a hunting dog in an era where most hunting techniques use a hunting dog to corner prey for a hunter to deliver the killing blow.

The huntsman gives them permission to look around his forest for wild dogs or wolves as long as they do not interfere with his hunting or tanning work.

What creature or creatures killed half the shepherd’s flock and where did they go?

189593.name: Pop Stream
189593.description: It’s the ultimate Movie Trivia game experience! Watch hundreds of real movie clips stream on your tablet as two teams go head-to-head in a game of cinema smarts. Think you know the answer? Hit the “Buzz In” button on the game board, and then wager an amount to win or lose. Pop Stream is packed full of over 10 different types of questions and challenges to stump you and your team. And did we mention you can take SELFIES? Simply take your photo and attach it to your in-game character to see a hilarious animated version. Pop Stream combines your favorite movie scenes with the excitement of a game show, right in your living room. Test your movie knowledge with Pop Stream, the ultimate movie trivia game!

189594.name: Dark Ruins (Issue 1 - 2014)
189594.description:
From the publisher:

Mini-zine adventures! Dark ruins is a series of (...) 16 page mini zines fashioned from a single sheet of 8.5×11 paper. Fully illustrated, with maps and monster encounters, universal symbol based stat lines, and treasures! Super fun! Pocket sized! Easy to use with any system! A purely visual item. No text beyond the title.

User Summary:
Small mountaintop temple ruins.

189595.name: Dark Ruins (Issue 2)
189595.description:
From the publisher:

Mini-zine adventures! Dark ruins is a series of (...) 16 page mini zines fashioned from a single sheet of 8.5×11 paper. Fully illustrated, with maps and monster encounters, universal symbol based stat lines, and treasures! Super fun! Pocket sized! Easy to use with any system! A purely visual item. No text beyond the title.

User Summary:
Wizard tower and surrounding swamp.

189596.name: Club Manager 2015
189596.description:
User Summary

A football management game in the style of Football Manager. Much simpler but unsurprising as it is the first game in what may be a series.

189597.name: Scene It? Turner Classic Movies Game Pack
189597.description: Expansion pack includes a Scene It' DVD and 100 trivia cards. The patented Optreve technology on the Scene It' DVD lets you play without seeing the same questions repeatedly. Requires original Scene It' board game (sold separately), TV and DVD player. For two or more players.

189598.name: Odditional materials
189598.description:
From publisher blurb:

A collection of hacks, adventures and sundry other oddities for Into the Odd. Inside the covers you'll find:

In Search of amson Aubrey, an adventure by Kamil Wegrzynowicz.
Four Arcana Ideas, arcana by Brian Wille.
Odd Dungeons, a hack to make Into the Odd feel more like D&D and similar fantasy games, by Eric Nieudan.
The Nightlight Circus, an adventure by Eric Nieudan.
CYBER:LONDON:ODD:HACK, an cyberpunk crime and law-enforcement hack by Sean Smith.
Oddbits, fuel for your odd campaign, by Kamil Wegrzynowicz.
Maze Rats, an adventure-fantasy hack of problem solving and survival by Ben Milton.

189599.name: Tower of the Stormlords
189599.description:
User summary:

An adventure set in the world of Jahannam. Characters face off against the King of the Ifrits in his tower eyrie. For characters of 8-15th level.

189600.name: Ben and Ed
189600.description:
User Summary

The player controls Ed the Zombie, who is forced to participate in a grotesque game show called "Rundead".

189601.name: The Ring of Gilrod
189601.description:
User summary:

This introductory adventure finds the beginning characters in a difficult predicament from which escape seems impossible.

189602.name: Dark Continents
189602.description:
User summary:

Dark Continents is a sourcebook providing background and adventures set in a colonial genre during England's period of foreign colonization of Africa. The information includes both historical and supernatural elements. Intended as a supplement for To Challenge Tomorrow, the publisher also advertised it as compatible with Call of Cthulhu, GURPS, and Hero System.

This item won the 1990 Sigma Award for Best RPG Aid. The sourcebook was reprinted at least once in 1992.

189603.name: Flower Fairy
boardgamefamily: HABA My Very First Games series
189603.description:
A cooperative stacking game to recognize and match colors.

It’s springtime. The buds of the water lilies have already opened. Three big flowers are also growing up on the little island, but have not yet blossomed. Rosalina, in her little bed, is waking up. First she yawns, then stretches and sets off flittering from one water lily leaf to the next.

As she arrives at the little island, she swings her magic wand ... and the three large flowers soon start to bloom. The goal is to build up the flowers before Rosalina reaches the flower island!

In your turn you roll the die and take a piece of the same color. The first piece of a color goes on the same color flower field. The next pieces go on top of the previously placed pieces.

The back of the board is a varient for older children. In this variant you don't have to recognize colors, but shapes.

189604.name: Krampus!
189604.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Krampus is an old and ancient creature bound into service by the elusive "Kringle" to bring terror to the enemies of the Holiday Season!

Learn more about the Krampus in this Witch Girls Supplement!

189605.name: Windforge
189605.description:
WindForge is a side-scrolling block-building game where you explore hostile skies in an ever-changing Steampunk world. Everything you see can be created or destroyed, creating an RPG without barriers that rewards creative problem solving and improvisation. Take off in fully customizable airships, and embark on a journey of discovery and survival that will take you to the heart of the world and beyond.

Features

Epic story line and quests that drive gameplay without constricting freedom
The first game to include minable sky whales, and meat blocks
Large completely destructible procedural world with multiple environments
Contra-style action mixed with the creative fun of Terraria
Build and fly fully-functional airships
Over 1200 craftable items and counting
Easy-to-control, skill-based combat with 360-degree aiming




Storyline
The modern way of life on Cordeus is reliant on refined Sky Whale oil. Everything from the machines used daily, to the food that is eaten, is ultimately dependent on the oil. The citizens of Cordeus are so hungry for oil that the once abundant population of Sky Whales is dwindling. At current rate, the noble species will face certain extinction in a few short years. To avoid falling back into the dark ages, civilization must find a new source of energy. It is said that an ancient people named the Aetherkin had exotic sources of energy. Energy more powerful than anything any human has ever seen. Unfortunately, research related to the Aetherkin is strictly forbidden by law. In an attempt to save humanity’s way of life, YOU have been secretly hired to uncover this ancient energy source.

Highlights
Freedom & Creativity
Explore, create and destroy anything!
A Dynamic Procedural World
Steampunk Airships

Source: The Game Website.

189606.name: Bakehouse Brawl
189606.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1536; Stage One: Ella McConnell; Stage Two: Jaye Foster; Stage Three: Meera Barry
Stage One and Two Title: WWB: World Wrestling Bakeoff




From the rules text:
Professional wrestling wasn’t pulling in the crowds; the grandmas who used to shout out anatomically unlikely encouragement had found a new passion: “Pie High” and “Fondue of You,” the two highest rated food channel shows. Intense sessions behind RecipeNet and Mr. McMacaroonof the World Wrestling Wranglers came up with a solution: The Bakehouse.

The Bakehouse wrestlers are the best in the business snack-stand hot dogs now only come in spelt sourdough buns, and the mention of a “heel” is just as likely to be referring to the end of a loaf of bread as it is an antagonist.

189607.name: Twilight Hotel
189607.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1537; Stage One: Rustin Simmons; Stage Two: Ben Wright; Stage Three: Tom Robbins
Stage One Title: Hotel
Stage Two Title: MicroHotel




From the Introduction:

Twilight Hotel is a collaborative storytelling game where the players take on the roles of characters in a hotel the group creates together. The characters are all wrapped up in a larger story that reveals itself as the game progresses.

189609.name: Automaton
189609.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1539; Stage One: Mendel Schmeidekamp; Stage Two: Scott Slomiany; Stage Three: Davide Pignedoli




From the Introduction:
Recently, humans lost the right to keep A.I.s as slaves and servants against their will. If an A.I. had evolved far enough to develop an independent personality and passed the so-called Self-Test, it could ask for renegotiation of its terms of employment, and by the law, humans could not refuse. A.I.s are now also free to leave and seek a new employment, if so they wish. Still, A.I.s do not have full constitutional rights equivalent to those of humans. They cannot vote, and are often segregated into Bot-Towns. They are usually looked at as dangerous machines, with quirks that are exposed as “bad programming”, without a moral compass. They are still treated either as freed-slaves, with contempt, by the wealthiest human population, or feared as unfair competition by human workers.
