Top Artists in the Business

189689.name: Games Unplugged (Issue 5 - Feb 2001)
189689.description:
From the cover:

The Gamy Winners!
...and the Winners of the First Annual GAMY AWARDS are...

Shotgun Webbing
A Quick Course on Creating Your Own Gaming Website

Jedi Knights TCG on the Horizon

189690.name: Pixel Star
189690.description:
Pixel Star is an open space shoot-em-up that thrives off arcade adrenaline, raw gameplay, and intense action.

Featuring loads of meaningful upgrades, merciless boss battles, and a unique visual style; endless action awaits in the open-space environment.

Source: The Developer Website.

189691.name: Games Unplugged (Issue 6 - Mar 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Warlord: Saga of the Storm Basic Rules
rpg: Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai
189691.description:
From the Cover:

Free Warlord Saga of the Storm Starter Pack and Official Rules

The Virtual Dungeon
The Best Role Playing and War Games Online

New Force Rising
An Indepth Look at the New Jedi Knights TCG

WARLORDS TCG busting into stores NOW!

189692.name: Flechette
189692.description:
From publisher blurb:

In your heroes' neverending battle they are bound to meet a myriad of villains! INJUSTICE FOR ALL is a series of super powered villains, teams, and organizations to make sure your campaign can always bring on the bad guys.

Every villain presented in INJUSTICE FOR ALL is fully illustrated in color with a complete character write-up for the Supers! Revised Edition roleplaying game and includes a background, notes on powers & tactics, and story ideas to incorporate into your campaign setting.

The characters in INJUSTICE FOR ALL can be dropped directly into your campaign or used to inspire your own creations.

189693.name: Cyberhawk
189693.description:
From publisher blurb:
In your heroes' neverending battle they are bound to meet other do-gooders! AND JUSTICE FOR ALL is a series of super powered heroes, teams, and organizations that can be heroic rivals, the heroes of another city or dimension, or... for those who play for the side of evil, arch enemies that always try to thwart your sinister plans!

Every hero presented in AND JUSTICE FOR ALL is fully illustrated in color with a complete character write-up for the Supers! Revised Edition roleplaying game and includes a background, notes on powers & tactics, and story ideas to incorporate into your campaign setting.

The characters in AND JUSTICE FOR ALL can be dropped directly into your campaign or used to inspire your own creations.

rpgseries: What Lies Beyond Reason Adventure Path
189694.name: What Lies Beyond Reason Player's Guide
189694.description:
From publisher blurb:

Anduria. The Eternal City. Jewel of the Realm. Built on foundations that are thousands of years old, it houses the greatest civilisation known to man.

But something sinister gnaws at its roots, exposing its flaws and failings, and bringing forth its darkest secrets. Secrets that threaten to topple this thriving metropolis, and plunge it into chaos and madness. Powerful forces are moving, and plots set in motion centuries ago begin to gather momentum.

Can you bring this city back from the edge or will you let it slip into the jaws of annihilation?

This guide is designed to offer players an insight to the locales, theme and tone of the What Lies Beyond Reason Adventure Path in order to create rich and evocative characters that suit the style of game to come.

189695.name: Difficult Circumstances (Pathfinder)
rpgseries: What Lies Beyond Reason Adventure Path
189695.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes you can just be in the wrong place at the wrong time...

Sheltering from a savage storm, a group of fledgling adventurers find themselves trapped by circumstances and powerful forces from a bygone age.

Escaping from dark and dismal caverns, the heroes must brave a nightmarish trek through haunted and hostile terrain, pursued by an mysterious assailant to the very walls of Anduria – home of the greatest civilisation in the world.

On the edge between madness and salvation, they must broker a deal with shadowy cults and political powers to determine not only their own fate, but potentially that of the Eternal City itself

Difficult Circumstances is an adventure for 1st level characters, and is the prologue to the What Lies Beyond Reason Adventure Path.

rpgseries: What Lies Beyond Reason Adventure Path
189696.name: Difficult Circumstances (5E)
189696.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes you can just be in the wrong place at the wrong time...

Sheltering from a savage storm, a group of fledgling adventurers find themselves trapped by circumstances and powerful forces from a bygone age.

Escaping from dark and dismal caverns, the heroes must brave a nightmarish trek through haunted and hostile terrain, pursued by an mysterious assailant to the very walls of Anduria – home of the greatest civilisation in the world.

On the edge between madness and salvation, they must broker a deal with shadowy cults and political powers to determine not only their own fate, but potentially that of the Eternal City itself

Difficult Circumstances is an adventure for 1st level characters, and is the prologue to the What Lies Beyond Reason Adventure Path.

189698.name: Dreamfall Chapters - Book Four: Revelations
189698.description:
Dreamfall Chapters is the long awaited episodic follow-up to the award-winning and bestselling adventure games The Longest Journey and Dreamfall: The Longest Journey.

An exciting story-driven episodic adventure for Windows/Mac/Linux and PlayStation 4, Dreamfall Chapters follows three characters on their journeys across two worlds — one a cyberpunk vision of the future, the other a magical fantasy world — as their stories and destinies intertwine.

Source: The Game Website.

189699.name: Dreamfall Chapters - Book Two: Rebels
189699.description:
Dreamfall Chapters is the long awaited episodic follow-up to the award-winning and bestselling adventure games The Longest Journey and Dreamfall: The Longest Journey.

An exciting story-driven episodic adventure for Windows/Mac/Linux and PlayStation 4, Dreamfall Chapters follows three characters on their journeys across two worlds — one a cyberpunk vision of the future, the other a magical fantasy world — as their stories and destinies intertwine.

Source: The Game Website.

189700.name: Dreamfall Chapters - Book Three: Realms
189700.description:
Dreamfall Chapters is the long awaited episodic follow-up to the award-winning and bestselling adventure games The Longest Journey and Dreamfall: The Longest Journey.

An exciting story-driven episodic adventure for Windows/Mac/Linux and PlayStation 4, Dreamfall Chapters follows three characters on their journeys across two worlds — one a cyberpunk vision of the future, the other a magical fantasy world — as their stories and destinies intertwine.

Source: The Game Website.

189701.name: Dreamfall Chapters - Book Five: REDUX
189701.description:
Dreamfall Chapters is the long awaited episodic follow-up to the award-winning and bestselling adventure games The Longest Journey and Dreamfall: The Longest Journey.

An exciting story-driven episodic adventure for Windows/Mac/Linux and PlayStation 4, Dreamfall Chapters follows three characters on their journeys across two worlds — one a cyberpunk vision of the future, the other a magical fantasy world — as their stories and destinies intertwine.

Source: The Game Website.

189702.description: The 16 new "Space" tiles in Expansion: Space introduce new goals and effects into Exoplanets. They increase your ability to influence the planetary system, and the effects depend on the direction you take the planetary system’s development.
189702.name: Exoplanets Expansion: Space

189703.description: The 4 new "Star" tiles in Expansion: Stars provide new effects for Exoplanets. Their effects depend on the direction you take the planetary system’s development.
189703.name: Exoplanets Expansion: Stars

189704.description: Expansion: Gravity includes 1 new "Special Effect" tile, Gravity, which allows you to negate the effects of Space tiles underneath "Planet" tiles in Exoplanets. The included black “crystals” act as a “wild” resource when creating life.
189704.name: Exoplanets Expansion: Gravity

189705.description:
In the board game A Dog’s World, you are a dog, and your goal is to out-score your opponents by leading the best dog life possible. Pick your breed, learn tricks, perform heroic deeds, and mark your territory as you travel from the suburbs - to the city - to the outskirts of town. But watch out for the Dog Catcher or you may end up in the pound. Obtain the most points by the end of the game to win!

A Dog’s World is a strategy game. Its part board game, part card game, and players will need to find the best way to achieve the most points before they’re breed’s lifeline reaches its end. In the board game portion, players must travel to specific territories to play cards. Marking territory (and marking over opponents’ territories) is also key. In the card game portion, players must build upon card combinations to advance their dog’s score. Players must learn Tricks, before they can perform Deeds or Heroic Deeds (earning points). Players will also need to figure out how to best utilize their breed’s special ability to gain an edge over their opponents.

A Dog’s World is all about dogs, and while it will appeal to dog owners and board game junkies, it is accessible to casual and die-hard board gamers alike.

189724.description:
The Row is a PNP game for 2 players.

It's a fast and easy to learn (10 min) cardgame for all kind of people.

You score points by matching the cards in THE ROW with the same colors on the active mission card. The game ends when all mission cards are scored.

- An Art pack with over 28 illustrations (including buildings’ visualizations, floor plans and a map of Crooked Wheel Streets’)

- 7 Buildings sheets with statistics for NPCs, walls, locks, etc.

All artworks included in “1001 streets and squares” are made by hand not digital drawings.

Artworks from this supplement are for personal use only.

189727.name: Fish Side
189727.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Driven by the opportunity to fulfill the needs of roleplayers, we introduce to you this innovative and outstanding project. This supplement is a mixture of descriptions and adventure ideas connected with the town of Fish Side. Because Fish Side is fleshed out with illustrations and descriptions of its locales, rather than particular rules, it can readily be used with any fantasy RPG system.

Most pages are divided into two parts. The top half is for game masters. There, you will find detailed descriptions of Fish Side as well as ideas for adventures. The bottom half is a set of illustrations that you can easily print and cut out as hand-outs for your players during the game, in order to enrich the description and verisimilitude. Included at the end of this supplement is a four-page, unkeyed map of the town that is perfect as a hand-out. We hope that you enjoy our little town of Fish Side.

189731.name: Storms of Shambhala
189731.description:
Dark times have fallen over the Earth. Mara, Lord of Deception, in his anger has found a way to shatter the Chintamani Stone. This wish fulfilling gem, the heart of Shambhala, protected the barrier between the realms of existence.
Piercing the void, Mara’s obscure whispers can be heard on the minds of all, driving many to madness. Those of weak will heed the call and flock to his war banner. Shambhala’s era of peace has quickly become a fleeting memory.
Will there be enough time to rally against the demon’s onslaught or will the Earth be left in ashes? Gather the shards of the Chintamani and rally your forces, for wicked times are upon us!

Storms of Shambhala
Mythological Deckbuilding Game- Easy to Learn, High Level of Strategic Choices, Endless Replay Value

Storms of Shambhala is a unique deckbuilding game that starts off small but ends big. Has each player adds in cards to form their ever more powerful deck the game scales with them, giving access to more powerful Heroes and Monsters. While the game is easy to learn and understand, the amount of depth that unfolds as the game progresses will draw you back in once it's over. This game is enjoyable by casual and experienced gamers alike!

The goal is to be the player with the most points once all the shards of the Chintamani Stone have been collected.


Train your Heroes to become more powerful throughout the game!

Build buildings to train your troops and construct over 20 unique artifacts!

Cast spells with your wizards to wreak havoc on the playing field!

Increase your production power by recruiting the Dwarves!

Enlist the aid of the Elves to wield devastating magic!

Utilize and master Shambhala’s 4 types of currency to bring you to victory: Wisdom, Attack, Gold, and Magic.

Features multicultural artwork from around the world dating back to the early 13th century!

189732.name: Planet Guide: Valar_7
189732.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Planet Guide line is a great resource for Players to "see" more of their adventures.

It inspires DMs providing them with set of beautifully drawn handouts of one location.

Planet Guide: Valar_7 consists of sized map, illustrations, handouts which can be easily printed or presented to players during a session, in order to enrich the planet's description and create a more precise presentation.

Please note that Planet Guide is stat free and generic.

It provides a frame for GM to build his own adventures based on visual aids.

What's Valar_7?

Valar_7 is a small industrial world with two lifeless moons. Two hundred years ago most life on the planet was destroyed by environmental cataclysm. This period is now widely known as The Great Crisis (TGC). During TGC most of colonists fled but few of them decided to stay. Those who stayed constructed underground vaults and shelters and waited for better times. Times that never came.

Due to TGC planet has changed. It transformed into barren wasteland, polluted with radiation, acid rains and infected with virus outbreaks. For many years Valar_7 was lost to civilisation

Now a new process of colonisation has begun. On Valar_7 scientists have discovered deposits of precious ore and rare minerals. Corporations sent miners and workers on planet’s surface. New settlements arise... And long forgotten secrets of first colonists are waiting to be revealed

189735.description:
A tabletop about deduction and deception

A card based game, featuring monsters on a party, playing with voodoo dolls.

Each player is a voodoo doll trying to discover his opponents identity or defeat'em in the processes, using the monsters weaknesses to attack and block enemies attacks.

The game is played by rounds. On your turn you draw cards form deck of cards with several objects that you will use to attack your opponents.

You will deal damage to your opponent health points, each player has 3 health points, the player who reches 0 is out.

Every monster has different wekanesses, so that will give you a clue of our opponents identities.

You can use the objects to block your enemies attacks as well, for example holy water blocks fire, and fire blocks holy water (burning its blessing)

You also have some special potions sush as health potions that you can use to heal yourself, or revealing potions to reaveal the blocking cards of your enemies.

You can try to guess your enemies identity, but if you fail the attempt, you lose 2 health points, if you sucess your enemy is out.
189735.name: Monsters Party: Voodoo Madness

It consists of a description of a typical baron’s castle, town and fief: floor-plans, information – where NPCs live, how amount of money you need to bribe a guard. You know what powers a local ruler holds and how he deals with crime. You can play “Barony” as a strategy role playing game as a baron, senior of hundred knights described in the “Manor”, and who, in the next two parts of the “Strongholds” series, is promoted to count and duke. The economic and demographic systems are easy, playtested and compatible with Dungeons and Dragons’ “Player’s Handbook”®, “Dungeon Masters’ Guide”® and the realities of Middle-Ages. The magic, heroes, and beasts from “Monster Manual”® are an integral part of economy and warfare.

189750.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

“The Great Bazaar vol. 1” is the first part of a series picturing iconic fantasy bazaar which can be added to any fantasy setting.

“The Great Bazaar vol. 1” consists of five iconic Stalls sheets with illustrations of the stalls, and portraits of the owners.

The supplement is divided into two sections :

- 5 Stall sheets ready to be fill with stats and info by DM

- 5 full page illustrations of detailed stalls which can be presented to players to enrich description during your game.

Also a map of one alley in The Great Bazaar where stalls are located is attached to the supplement.

So..

Welcome to The Great Bazaar Stranger! Where traders from around the world try to sell rare spices, religious paraphernalia, weapons, adventuring gear, magic ingredients and more…

Enrich your games with our Gaming aids!

189751.name: The Sanctuary of the Silver Shine
189751.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

"The Sanctuary of the Silver Shine" is a Rivendell-like city which was deserted by the Elves half a millennium ago, and is hidden still amid the mists, and still full of relics of the sublime architecture and magic. The PC's are the first of mortal Men, to have rediscovered it and have a chance of learning about its secrets, the treasures and the Sentinel and the legendary ghostly unicorn. In the Sanctu?ary one can gain the friendship of a mighty ally, a safe haven, some mag?ic, some treasures and wisdom, or do over a dozen missions... You just simply cannot be bored..

The Forge Studios presents and represents a new quality in game's accessories combining 'art' packs and ordinary gaming material.
Every PDF from The Forge Studios consists of two parts. The first one is designed exclusively for the DM. In it you can find exact plans, visualizations, ideas, and adventure hooks.

The second part is a set of visual aids which can be easily printed or presented to other players during a session, in order to enrich the description and create a more precise presentation.

"The Sanctuary of the Silver Shine" consists of:
- 19 page long description
- 1 map of the lavender valley
- 2 floor plans
- 6 view drawings

189752.name: Malifaux: Master of Puppets – Collodi Box Set
189752.description:
There are many old relics from humanity's first time through the Breach. Most of these are the usual variety- ruins, coins, books. But there are forgotten things as well, things that were imbued with magic and life.

Collodi is a living puppet, the size of a human adult. It was made to be an entertainer, a marionette that told stories through others of its kind. Collodi was a delight and a wonder of its age that was created to love its work, and so it did. At the closing of the Breach, after the mayhem that followed, the puppeteer was left alone in Malifaux, with no more children to share stories with. The next century passed slowly. To make up for its loneliness, Collodi began making new puppets from bits of wood it scavenged. These fake children became the audience for new shows and stories, but it was never quite the same. As time went on Collodi began to slowly drift away, losing its grip on itself.

When the Breach reopened, Collodi rushed to the newly arrived settlers, drawn by the laughter of children. The adults attacked the living puppet, forcing it away with torches and axes. Denied the ability to fulfill its purpose, Collodi learned to hate. It vowed to teach humanity the emptiness it had felt for so long in the absence of children. It started making a new kind of puppet, using the blood of stolen children as a template. Collodi wanders Malifaux in its painted wagon, hiding in plain sight behind the masks it wears, still committed to its now twisted purpose.

Collodi’s box comes with nine models, including Collodi himself. The Marionettes serve as Collodi’s totems, giving it fast, tough minions that are utterly loyal to the puppet’s evil will. The Wicked Dolls provide another variety of useful minion, in that they can repair other puppets and teleport next to an enemy in the blink of an eye. Vasilisa watches over all these puppets with a caring eye, but should an enemy catch up with its incredible speed, they will have to contend with its sharp needle and expert sewing skills.

189753.description:

Together they expand Ptolus with illustrations of buildings not pictured in the core book.

What’s in a Ptolus Sketchbook?
- Building illustrations inspired by Monte’s descriptions.
- Illustrations of details which could be found in the featured buildings (signs, furniture, typical items).
- Blank handouts of letters, advertisements, etc. which can be easily customized to your needs.

Every Ptolus Sketchbook from The Forge Studios consists of two parts. The first one is stylized and consists of illustrations made on a parchment background.

The second part is a set of black and white illustrations which can be easily printed or presented to players during a session, in order to enrich the locale’s description and create a more precise presentation.

189756.name: Malifaux: The Plague Cometh – Hamelin Box Set
189756.description:
Eons ago, Plague was a preeminent alchemist in Malifaux, well respected in his field of study. He developed a fascination with decay and aging, focusing his research on the manipulation of both. A tragic accident during an experiment involving the aether and a plague rampaging through Malifaux City nearly killed him. Drowning in his own blood, the alchemist tapped into the aether desperately. Screaming in agony, his eyes closed. The next day, Plague's eyes opened.

Few records remain from the years of the Tyrants of Malifaux. The only certain thing is that they were locked away, trapped because they could not be killed. Plague slept millennia in the necropolis deep below Malifaux City. He was awoken by Hamelin the Rat Catcher, a pitiful bully on the run from the Guild. Hamelin's death was messy and horrific, reminiscent of Plague's first rebirth. Immediately, the Tyrant went after His ultimate goal, only to be prevented by Kirai Ankoku who shattered His physical form. It took months, but Plague eventually reformed Himself. Now, He acts more slowly to ensure His victory in the long run, searching for a new method of ascension into the aether- and the acquisition of true immortality.

Plague is the most aggressive of the active Tyrants. He holds to a strange view, that all of the Tyrants are playing a great game, one which is only worth playing because existence itself is the gamble. While His first attempt at ascension, harnessing the power of the Red Cage, failed miserably, He has discovered new methods to try. With everything on the line, He refuses to admit defeat.

Hamelin’s box comes with ten models, including Hamelin himself. Four of those models are Malifaux Rats, the skulking vermin who invariably follow in Hamelin’s wake. Also present are the Stolen, Hamelin’s totems, who serve him either as a gamble to prolong his own life when killed, or as fresh meat to lure more Malifaux Rats into the battle. The Obedient Wretch helps her master by throwing rats at her enemies, some of which even survive to scurry away into the shadows. Hamelin’s dog, Nix, is also present, if only as a festering plague-ghost who excels at locking down groups of enemy models.

189758.name: Malifaux: Temple of Dawn – Shenlong Box Set
189758.description:
Even as a young monk in the temple of High River, Shenlong was considered exceptional. What surprised his instructors was the determination he showed to learn the other styles when exposed to them. His brutality was matched by a ruthless cunning that drove him to master every temple style. While he was fully aware of the political power this granted him in the valley, he was not prepared for what would follow.

As dusk fell one day, sunlight blazed from an isolated temple on the valley wall, said to house the Dragon. Shenlong, the only person capable of looking at the searing light, found himself drawn to the ancient building. He walked in alone, emerging the following sunrise as more than a man. He was covered head to toe in tattooed scales, sunlight blazing in his eyes. Where he trod, the ground scorched. A new era in the valley had begun; the Dragon had chosen a new host.

Although he doesn’t look it, Shenlong is thought to be more than eighty years old. The Dragon does not permit its hosts to age, holding them at their physical peak as long as it chooses to inhabit them. While this arrangement is never eternal, Dragonhosts are known to have lived for several centuries. As long as the Dragon has need of a host for his plans, Shenlong will be near immortal. With the Dragon now turning its ancient eyes to Malifaux, his current host has a great deal to do before he becomes tiresome and is cast aside.

Shenlong’s crew comes with seven models, including Shenlong himself. The Monks of High River are brutal combatants with flaming punches and kicks, and they serve Shenlong aside his totems, the less flashy but equally devoted Peasants. The towering Sensei Yu ensures that everyone, monk and peasant alike, is properly trained, no matter how many legs get broken in the process.

189766.name: Rebellious Archetypes Volume VI
189766.description:
From publisher blurb:

Be a Rebel with a Cause!

Not every evil lurks in deep, dark dungeons far away from innocent townsfolk, waiting patiently for adventurers to kick down their doors and start fighting. Some monsters don't just prey on society from without, but have burrowed and wormed their way into the very heart of the civilized world, and twist and corrupt the very laws that are supposed to protect the innocent, using them to oppress and exploit them, instead. These evils are no less a threat than the ones that most adventurers face, but many PCs are ill-equipped to deal with them. This is a job for rebels.

This book presents five new rebellious archetypes for five different classes. Included are the rebel bloodline, a bloodrager bloodline for those whose blood boils at the thought of being controlled, and whose destructive impulses and shared rage allow them—and their friends—to fight the power, two new subdomains, independence and secrecy, the eldritch malcontent, a magus archetypes that focuses on hit and run tactics and blends their magic more with roguish stealth than soldierly discipline, the chaos discipline, a psychic discipline focused on wild and unpredictable magic, and the freedom spirit, a shaman spirit dedicated to freedom in all its forms, whether of body, mind, or spirit.

Whether you're about to embark on a politically-themed campaign (such as the official Paizo adventure path focusing on revolution), or you just want a selection of exciting new abilities for passionate and freedom-loving PCs, this book has lots of tantalizing options to offer. Even GMs can get in on the fun, as several of the archetypes here are perfect for rebellious villains as well, and can make for exciting and memorable encounters.

189789.description:

BEAST FROM THE ABYSS

Free Encounter for levels 1-4 suitable for D20 system,
Web Enhancements to the “Monster Lairs: Goblins’ Caves” by The Forge Studios.

ADVENTURE HOOK

PC’s, during the journey through the caves, find and defeat Gibbering Mouther that preaches worshipping a god of cannibalism. To their amazement from the slit in the ceiling a rain of gold starts to fall down.

Find out what could happened next.

189790.name: Dungeons: Basic Set
189790.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

'Dungeons: Basic Set' comprises 37 B&W dungeon corridors and rooms suitable for role-playing and miniature games. Each map tile is scaled to 1inch, and is designed to fit with other tiles to create complex dungeons. Furthermore - the product contains 12 cards with dungeon features and treasures illustrations to help DMs create new challenges and rewards. These special cards are easy to print, cut, and can be presented to other players during a session, in order to enrich the description and create a more precise presentation.

'Dungeons: Basic Set' is a versatile supplement, replete with visual aids, which can be easily added to any campaign.

The set includes:

- 18 rooms

- 11 corridors sections

- 8 intersections

- 3 pre-made sample dungeons' maps

- Dungeon features sheet with 6 Dungeon features cards

- Treasures sheet with 6 Treasure cards

All illustrations and map tiles included in 'Dungeons: Basic Set' are made by hand not by computer.

189791.name: Dungeons: Basic Set – Bonus Tiles
189791.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

'Dungeons: Basic Set' – Bonus Tiles comprises 4 B&W dungeon corridors (2) and rooms (2) suitable for role-playing and miniature games. Each map tile is scaled to 1inch, and is designed to fit with other tiles from 'Dungeons: Basic Set' (available from The Forge Studios) to create complex dungeons.

All illustrations and map tiles included in 'Dungeons: Basic Set' – Bonus Tiles are made by hand not by computer.

Enjoy our free set!

189792.name: Island Of The Ice Maggot 003: Ice Maggot Temple
189792.description:

Each map tile is scaled to 1inch, and is designed to fit with other tiles to create complex battle map. All tiles are easy to print, cut, and can be presented to other players during a session, in order to enrich the description and create a more precise presentation.

Island Of The Ice Maggot: Ice Maggot Temple is a versatile supplement, replete with visual aids, which can be easily added to any campaign.

THE SUPPLEMENT INCLUDES
40 printable, colour tiles:
36 new tiles
4 bonus tiles from different extensions

189797.name: The Broken Coin Inn
189797.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Enjoy our newest Free supplement - 'The Broken Coin Inn'. The versatile supplement is ready for use in your fantasy campaign.

From the outside, this inn looks much like any other inn of the town. The stone walls are a dark grey and the wooden frame is beginning to show its age. The main building has two storeys and three large chimneys breaking through the tiles on the roof. The front door is located in the right corner of the building, where the road turns, and a large man even needs to bend down so as not to hit his head.

The supplement consist of:

-Inn’s and staff description

- Adventure hook

- Stats for key character

189798.name: The Cozy Hearth Inn
189798.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Enjoy our newest Free supplement - The Cozy Hearth Inn. The versatile supplement is ready for use in your fantasy campaign.

The Cozy Hearth is a sturdy, two-story structure with a basement. The exterior walls up to the second floor are constructed of heavy fieldstone, while the interior walls and furnishings are craft­ed of polished oaken timbers. A heavy oak door leads to the central hall from the wall-length cov­ered porch outside.

The supplement consist of:

-Inn’s and staff description

- Encounter Options (EL-1)

- Stats for key character

189804.name: Steel Rain
189804.description:
User Summary

A shoot em up where your ship is able to transform into three different forms giving you different ways to attack. Each stage also gives you credits that you can spend on upgrades and as you level up skill points can be spent to make six different powerups you can activate more powerful. Each planet in the game has three stages and once cleared credits can be used to colonize the planet, buildings can be created over time and research can be completed to improve your weapons and colonies.

189806.description:
From the publisher:
Race to space from your own backyard!

Compete with neighborhood kids to build the coolest rockets and launch your entire squad before the others. Watch out for Dad, big brother Jack, and your dog Ace, who'll totally wreck your plans. Mom is always there to help, if you kids would just behave!

Rocket Squad is a fast-paced card game for 2 to 6 players. Lay down rocket boosters, build up rockets one box after another, and use your family to mess up your friends’ plans. The first player to launch one rocket of each squad will end the game, but the player that has launched the most impressive rockets will score the most points and win!

Rules Summary:

Setup
Shuffle all the cards and deal 4 to each player.

On Your Turn
You may play as many cards as you like to:

Place a Booster on an empty Launchpad
Place a Fuselage bit on top of a Rocket
Use a Family Member to disrupt the game
Discard or keep cards in hand and redraw back to 4 cards




Game End & Scoring
The first player to launch a Rocket of each color triggers the game end, with each other player getting one more turn.
The player with the highest total of launched Rockets is the winner (tallest Rocket breaks ties).
189806.name: Rocket Squad

189807.description:
From the publisher:

Twenty years ago, during the Klondike Gold Rush, over a hundred thousand prospectors traveled deep into the Alaskan territory. Most of them perished in the ice, a few got rich, and some awoke terrible, ancient evils. Now, down in usually temperate Arkham, the winds are blowing harder and colder than ever before. The Miskatonic has frozen over. Some people complain of insatiable hunger and sometimes the newspapers even report cannibalism. You know all too well that the Ancient Ones are causing the weather and hunger, but this time you cannot fight them from within the Arkham Museum, or even out on Arkham’s streets. You must brave the brutal conditions that killed thousands of prospectors, and fight ferocious creatures from this world and others, or else the cold, hunger, and ice will devastate humanity.

Omens of Ice takes you and your fellow investigators on a treacherous journey into the Alaskan wildernesses, where you must solve the mysteries of three terrible new Ancient Ones. Whether you choose to travel in summer or are forced to go in winter’s dark, at every step you’ll face terrible perils, from the port of Anchorage to the forest paths and mountain passes of the interior. You must constantly fight not only wild animals and ravenous monsters, but frostbite, starvation, and the madness that befalls many who enter this frozen, isolated, white world.
189807.name: Elder Sign: Omens of Ice

189808.name: Manor: Web Enhancement - Werewolf
189808.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

WEREWOLF

Free Encounter for levels 1-4 suitable for D20 system,
Web Enhancements to the “Manor” by The Forge Studios.

ADVENTURE HOOK

It’s just before a full moon and the travelling PCs are attacked in the evening by the wolves commanded by a huge she-wolf. The beasts are driven away by a sound of a bell from hamlet.

The village is afraid of wolves. A local knight looks for trappers to hunt for the beasts and to help in a fam­ily matter.

Find out what could happened next.

189809.name: Barnaba Blumbergs' Guidebook Vol. 1
189809.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Maps of regions near and far; maps of worlds forgotten and unknown; maps of realms lost, secret, and extraordinary . . . all are beautifully drawn on sheets of parchment or tanned leather by licensed cartographer Burnaby Blumberg

The 'Barnaba Blumbergs' Guidebook vol. 1' consists of:
- first part of an overland map ( You will find other maps' parts in next 'Barnaba Blumbergs' Guidebooks')
- 3 maps of a typical hamlet
- 1 floor plan of a barn
- 1 floor plan of a hut

189810.name: Barnaba Blumbergs' Guidebook Vol. 2
189810.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Maps of regions near and far; maps of worlds forgotten and unknown; maps of realms lost, secret, and extraordinary . . . all are beautifully drawn on sheets of parchment or tanned leather by licensed cartographer Burnaby Blumberg

The 'Barnaba Blumbergs' Guidebook vol. 2' consists of:
- second part of an overland map ( You will find other maps' parts in next 'Barnaba Blumbergs' Guidebooks')
- 2 maps of a typical hamlet
- 2 floor plans of a windmill

189811.name: Barony Arts
189811.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

“Barony” is the universal background for a medieval fantasy setting, a d20 basis for improvisation of DM.

'Barony Arts' More images and maps from the Strongholds series. It comprises 19 images (A4, B/W)

189812.name: Commander Prestige Class
189812.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

A commander is someone who commands his subordinates (an army or adventuring party). NPC commanders are usually found at the head of an army's unit or units, either on the march or defending a castle at a strategically important site. The PC commander can support his adventuring party at a dungeon with his Formation, Feat Lend, Tactics and Saving Throw Aid abilities. A class is flexibly designed to imitate the abilities of famous historical or fictional officers known from books and movies (Julius Caesar, Genghis Khan, Napoleon Bonaparte, William Wallace from "Braveheart", Maximus from "Gladiator", Theoden from "Lord of the Rings?). A commander has a tactician's mind, a cartographer's overview of disputed landscape, and a way with words that can inspire his subordinates to give their all at war.

Commander prestige class can be found in The Forge "Strongholds 2: Barony" the pdf e-book also. ommander prestige class will be expanded in "Strongholds 3: County" with some battle-system abilities.

189813.name: Doors
189813.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Doors is a short, imaginative and versatile description of five doors, so every DM can easily add it to their adventure. Every door consist of two illustrations: one 'as seen by PC's' and, secondly, 'what happens after starting the protection of the doors'. As in 'Treasure Chests' ( the previous supplement from this series) every passage can be opened and dismantled by two methods, namely - HOLMES and JONES: forcible/with series of tests and with deciphering the riddles. 'Doors' is an accessory for BG at the levels 1-12.

The Forge Studios presents and represents a new quality in game's accessories combining 'art' packs and ordinary gaming material.
Every PDF from The Forge Studios consists of two parts. The first one is designed exclusively for the DM. In it you can find exact plans, visualizations, ideas, and adventure hooks.

The second part is a set of visual aids which can be easily printed or presented to other players during a session, in order to enrich the description and create a more precise presentation.

'Doors' consists of:
- 9 page long description
- 10 view drawings

189814.name: Treasure Chests: by The Forge Studios
189814.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

'Treasure Chests' is a description of five chests: for the elves, for the temple, for the dwarfs, for the wizard and for the races living under the sea ? with the option of adapting them to the other locations. The chests are valuable in themselves, and overcoming traps, locks and guards is an additional encounter. Each chest is consists of two illustrations: one ?as seen by PC's' and secondly ?what happens after starting the protection of the chest'. Each trap can be dismantled by two methods namely - HOLMES and JONES: forcible/with series of tests and with deciphering the riddles. ?Treasure Chests' is an accessory for PC at the levels 1-20.

The Forge Studios presents and represents a new quality in game's accessories combining 'art' packs and ordinary gaming material.
Every PDF from The Forge Studios consists of two parts. The first one is designed exclusively for the DM. In it you can find exact plans, visualizations, ideas, and adventure hooks.

The second part is a set of visual aids which can be easily printed or presented to other players during a session, in order to enrich the description and create a more precise presentation.

'Treasure Chests' consists of:
- 10 page long description
- 10 view drawing

189815.name: A-Men 2
189815.description:
User Summary

Using a variety of soldiers, you solve puzzles, kill automated enemies, and meet the helicopter.

189816.description:
Ready, Set, TACO! Take an order ticket, grab a taco shell and be the first to STUFF IT with all the correct toppings! It's FAST, FUN and NACHO average game!!!

Ingredient cards are spread across the table, face-down. Each player is given a taco shell and a secret recipe card. One player shouts, "Olé!" and in a manic free-for-all, players grab one card at a time, trying to complete their recipes by stuffing the correct ingredients in their taco shells.

If you find a cockroach, you must discard all ingredients and start again — your taco is ruined! You may also find Antacid cards, which allow you to force other players to throw out all of THEIR ingredients and start again.

The first player to complete their secret recipe (correctly) wins a point, and the first to three points wins the game.
189816.name: Taco Takeover

189817.name: Judges Guild Journal (Issue 8 - Feb/Mar 1978)
rpgissuearticle: Judges Guild Teleports to New Location
189817.description:
Judges Guild Journal
Issue 8 (Q)
February/March 1978

Announcing new location
Staff introductions
Letters
Extensive advertisements

189818.name: The Nucleus Roleplay System (Version 5)
189818.description:
User summary:

The Nucleus Roleplay System is the primary rules book for the Nucleus Modifiable Game System (both titles are used apparently interchangeably). The system is designed to be a generic, universal rules system that is utilized with genre supplements to establish a campaign.

Characters in the system have Basic Attributes (Agility, Deftness, Endurance, Intelligence, Might, Perception, and Presence). Attributes have Values ranging from -30 to 30, with an "average" person having a zero score. Attribute Values are purchased from a Proficiency Points pool. A number of Derived Attributes are calculated from Basic Attributes, most of them relating to combat. Characters have a Derived Attribute called Overall Life Points which are analogous to hit points in other systems. Characters also have Traits (negative and positive). Most opposed actions and combat elements use either a modified percentile roll (D100) or a type of action table that determines how many and which type of dice to roll.

189819.name: The Assault on Goblintown
189819.description:
The Assault on Goblintown is a strategy dungeon crawling game for two players. The first player runs the adventurers - skilled, armored, magically enhanced, and freshly bathed. They are invading Goblintown to capture their treasure and drive them from the countryside. The second player plays the Goblins - sneaky, tunnel-digging, weak and utterly lacking in the social graces. They make up for it by their unending numbers and ability to make new tunnels to attack the adventurers from any direction!

The game is made from laser cut wood - 20 Goblins, 4 Warriors, 2 Archers, 1 Wizard and 1 Priest. It also comes with 4 laser cut isomorphic boards that fit together in many ways to create a new Goblintown for each game! It is all contained in a hand made, laser cut red plywood box that looks outstanding on any game shelf!

189820.name: GUESS! Wörterraten für Schnelldenker
189820.description: The active player gets a strip, where he writes down one of the pre-given words or alternately presenting an own word. Then he pushes the strip into the plate and covers it. The other players open one after the other a slider, which hide each a character. Who thinks he knows the word calls it. It is controlled. If guessed correctly, the player gets one point for each slide still closed. If he guessed wrong, the number of enclosed slides his Points are reduced. After an agreed number of rounds the player with the most points wins.

189821.description: The Essen Spiel 2015 Promo City Tokens (2 per set).
189821.name: Between Two Cities: Essen 2015 Promo City Tokens

189822.name: Koban Itadaki
boardgamepublisher: 篠原遊戯重工 (Shinohara Yugi Juko)
189822.description: A trick-taking card game played over 9 rounds. Players play a card from their hand and offer a bribe to other players to play the same color. The leader of the largest color group pays out their bribe and collects the points being played for that round. The points to be won change every time, and only 2 players ever know the value.

189823.description:
Small post card expansion for Cacao. This was first distributed to all Patreon supporters of the German Bretterwisser podcast. It's not made of thick cardboard like the tiles of cacao, it's just like a regular postcard.

Rules:
This move can be played by each player in the game once. Instead of placing a worker tile next to a jungle tile, a player has the opportunity to place a 1-1-1-1 worker tile on the grey space on the postcard. Subsequently the player may now choose 2 from the 4 adjacent jungle tiles on the card an execute their action once. Afterwards the worker tile is placed face down next to the postcard, for other players to see, who already used the postcard.
189823.name: Cacao: Die Lichtung

189824.name: Osetia 2008-2015
189824.description:
Game covers first european war of the XXI century - conflict between Georgia, Russia, and the Russian-backed self-proclaimed republics of South Ossetia and Abkhazia. The war took place in August 2008 following a period of worsening relations between Russia and Georgia, both formerly constituent republics of the Soviet Union. The fighting took place in the strategically important Transcaucasia region.

Game contains three scenario - historial one and two hypotethical, including 2015 conflict with NATO's units involved.

Game was published in 41 issue of the "Taktyka i Strategia" magazine, in both Polish and English editions.

189825.name: Airport Madness:  Time Machine
189825.description:
User Summary

You manage an airfield from 1925 to 1970, starting with an open field and a few planes and gradually adding buildings and increased air traffic. Balancing take-offs with landings is key to avoid crashes (and scenario failure). The graphics are basic, looking like a much older game.

189826.name: Playing Nature's Year
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode 54 - Fall of Magic, Cheat Your Own Adventure, Witch: The Road to Lindisfarne
rpg: Ramble in the New Mown Hay
189826.description:
(from the back cover)

Here are eight beautiful little original games, evoking our seasonal celebrations and the cycle of New England’s natural year, recalling the oldest games we know and the first games we learn as children: wishing games, fortune telling games, and storytelling games.

(from the author's introduction)

After each game, there are five brief essays: my commentary on
symbolism in the game, then Jodi’s animals of the season, Emily’s silent green companions of the season, Vincent’s recipe and notes from the kitchen, and Epidiah’s stories of the night sky. Use these to expand your observation and celebration of each season. Add your own notes. Teach these games to other people, and make up your own. Play with anyone and everyone, the whole year through.

189827.name: Panzer Grenadier: La Campagne de Tunisie
189827.description:
From the publisher:

In 1942, Allied forces invaded North Africa, while Axis troops marched in to resist them. The French Army of Africa fought against both of them. This is a thing that really happened.

In La Campagne de Tunisie, designer Philippe Léonard (1940 - The Fall of France) tells this story in a series of 13 Panzer Grenadier scenarios, as the French fight the Americans, the Germans, the British and the Italians (but not all at the same time). Initially resisting the American and British invaders, the French see things differently after the Germans toss aside the German-French Armistice of 1940 and occupy all of France. The French - including troops from Morocco, Algeria and Tunisia – then fight against the Germans and Italians, providing a major component of the British First Army in northern Tunisia.

La Campagne de Tunisie includes 88 new playing pieces with some additional units for the German, American, British and Italian armies, but mostly the eclectic troops and weapons of the Army of Africa. There are Moroccan Goums, tough mountain tribesmen from Morocco who love to fight but are just as interested in looting. Camel cavalry. Obsolescent limited-production French tanks. And for the first time in Panzer Grenadier, the French Foreign Legion. Plus you get a set of 13 scenarios.

La Campagne de Tunisie is a supplement for Panzer Grenadier: An Army at Dawn. It is not a complete game: ownership of An Army at Dawn (and only An Army at Dawn) is necessary to play all of the 13 scenarios included. La Campagne de Tunisie also includes 88 laser-cut and mounted playing pieces.

189828.name: Spirits of Xanadu
189828.description:
User Summary

An FPS adventure, control a lone operative attempting to bring the research ship Xanadu back to Earth after messages from the crew have stopped being received after they arrived at a mysterious planet.

189829.description:
The year is 20XX, a mysterious object fell from outer space. Not long after, zombie outbursts have been reported all around the world!!

In Zombie Tower 3D, you will play as a one of the characters trapped inside a building crawling with zombies. Working with your teammates, you must try to evacuate the building before it collapses. But beware! Zombies will appear out of nowhere every so often, craving for your flesh. There are also other desperate survivors in the building, waiting to be rescued. You must search the building for various tools to fight off the zombies, save survivors, and evacuate from the building!

Zombie Tower features a revolutionary 3D stand-up board. During the game, you may only look at your own play space, so you will have to actively communicate with your teammates about your situation to call for help or offer rescue. Items are also passed through small slits between the walls, and not directly to other players. After fulfilling the escape conditions, each player will get victory points depending on the number of survivors saved and completion of their minor objective cards, and the true winner will be determined.
189829.name: Zombie Tower 3D
boardgamepodcastepisode: 6. Devon Dice podcast, The Castles of Burgundy review
The Game Pit Podcast: Episode 62 - LobSterCon XI Roundtable

189830.name: Pantarei
189830.description:
In Pantarei, each player has nine pieces — three each marked with one, two or three symbols — and these pieces are shuffled with a neutral piece, then placed in a line.

Players take turns moving the top one or two pieces on a stack 1-3 spaces, with the distance being dependent on the number of symbols on the top piece being moved. Form a stack of seven pieces, and you win.

189831.name: MesoZoica
189831.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




Mesozoica is a prehistoric park tycoon simulator. Offering three unique perspectives that allow you to build, live and destroy.

Source: The Game Website.

189832.description:
Crewman cards are not considered players, but are special Characters that are used to reduce the difficulty of a scenario. Regardless of the number of players, before you start the game, you can choose 1 Crewman card.
All crewman cards do not affect the total number of players when considering Shelter, Roof and Palisade costs or in any other case.
There are 6 different Crewman cards available in this set.

For the Artist and the Old Cook apply the same rules as for Friday, with the following changes:

both Artist and the Old Cook require Shelter, otherwise during the Night phase they receive Wounds for sleeping in the open air
Determination tokens are useless for them
the Old Cook is affected by weather
when playing with the Artist the First Player receives +1 Determination in the Morale phase
when playing with the Old Cook during each Hunting action the Beast gives the players +1 Food and +1 Fur




Pilgrim

Playing with Pilgrim each round during Action phase one of the players may re-roll one Action die of any color.
Is immune to all game effects.




Quatermaster

Playing with Quatermaster each Starting Item can be used 4 times instead of only 2 (place 4 markers on each Starting Item card at the beginning of the game).
Is immune to all game effects.




Sawbones

Playing with Sawbones any time a player heals a Wound and this makes his wound marker pass the Morale descrease symbol then increase Morale level by 1.
Has a limited life.
Is affected by Weather.
Doesn’t have to eat in the Night phase.
Doesn’t provide an additional pawn.




Tribesman

Allows you to play the game with face-up Hunting deck.
Doesn’t provide an additional pawn.
Is immune to all game effects.
189832.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Crewman Deck I
boardgamefamily: Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island

189833.name: Monopoly: Cthulhu
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 194
189833.description:
Description from the publisher:

Set foot for Miskatonic University, and battle it out with other Cthulhu occultists to find out who truly is the Great Old One among you.

Monopoly: Cthulhu features fun Cthulhu and H.P. Lovecraftian style imagery, plus game tokens straight from the Cthulhu mythos!

The winner of Monopoly: Cthulhu shall be deemed most like the Great Old One and the most fit to inherit his mantle. Whether you win or not, you lose and become one of Cthulhu's mindless zombies. Hooray!

189834.name: The Corsairs of Cythera
189834.description:
User summary:

The Corsairs of Cythera is a sea adventure in which characters must win over a pirate king to save an empire.

For levels 3-6.

Received an honorable mention as "Best Role-Playing Adventure" in the 1982 Origins Awards.

189835.name: Ysgarth Ethnography Sourcebook
189835.description:
User summary:

The Ysgarth Ethnography Sourcebook provides substantive background information on the Ysgarth campaign setting, focusing especially on the races and cultures of the region.

189836.name: Rivermasters of Arania
189836.description:
User summary:

In Rivermasters of Arania the characters move north to encounter the strange merchants and heroes of the Kingdom of Arania while on a trading mission.

For character levels 6-9.

189837.name: EsperAgents
189837.description:
User summary:

EsperAgents provides background information and alternative rules to allow play in a genre of psychic espionage and supernatural investigation. While the supplement was intended for use with To Challenge Tomorrow, much of the information provided is generic and could be used in any similar game.

189838.name: Triad
189838.description:
To Challenge Tomorrow - Expansion One

User Summary:

Triad presents a far-future background, with additional
rules, weapons, and three scenarios, plus lots of background to support a campaign in To Challenge Tomorrow.

At least two editions were published.

189839.name: Challengers: Background and Adventures
189839.description:
User summary:

Challengers is a complete superhero role-playing game, featuring revised and updated mechanics derived from To Challenge Tomorrow, with rules for running an innovative superhero campaign, with over 100 powers, six adventures and dozens of villains. Challengers is a very flexible superhero system ideally suited to play with low-power characters.

189840.name: Cynfelyn, Prince of Prydein
189840.description:
User summary:

In Cynfelyn, Prince of Prydein characters move up in the world of international intrigue and espionage between neighboring countries.

For levels 4-6.

189841.name: Castle Poker
189841.description:
In Castle Poker players use one standard deck of cards with 6 special cards added. Players also have a castle card each with 3 vacant spots on the bottom, where cubes are placed, to represent their progress building their castle.

5 cards are dealt to each player. Then in order,from the left of the dealer, players may discard to The Moat, as many as three from their hand. When all the players have discarded, hands are refilled to 5 cards.

Then in order from the left of the dealer players may make one bid of stones (cubes) from their supply. When each player has made ONE bid, all hands are revealed.

The player with the lowest poker hand looses their bid back to The Quarry. All other player get an extra stone from the Quarry to their supply. They also keep the stones they bid.

The player with the highest poker hand may place half the stones (rounded down) they bid onto their castle if they also bid the most stones.

The special cards include a messenger, a trebuchet and barrels of supplies.

189842.name: Baelnok, Holy City of Arberth
189842.description:
User summary:

In Baelnok, Holy City of Arberth, the characters are thrust into a world of politics and intrigue in a major city.

For character levels 3-5.

189843.name: Catorize
189843.description:
User Summary

You are a cat trying to jump between ledges and avoid the reddish lava walls. Using the mouse to plan the arc of your trajectory, you aim for required buttons and moving air to get to the exit button.

189845.name: Redneck Invasion
189845.description:
We’ve all thought about it. What would we build if we could create our perfect city? The only problem is the hipsters, preppies, soccer parents, and rednecks all want in. In Redneck Invasion, you control one of these factions and compete for cultural influence over the town. Build businesses and cultural institutions, secure city council seats, and watch your pile of cash and cultural influence grow over time. Strike deals with other players to launch joint projects one moment, like a Trucker Hat Store for the Hipsters and Rednecks or Swimming Pool for the Preppies and the Soccer Parents. In the next moment, use event cards to send lawsuits and campaign attack ads to undermine your opponents’ best laid plans. After all, only one group of invaders will end up with the city of their dreams.

The game board has four sectors: Downtown, Midtown, Suburbs, and Boondocks. Buildings Downtown deliver greater returns, but they also cost more to build. Players build both Businesses and Cultural Institutions. You can choose to build alone or in conjunction with other players.

Businesses generate Cash, and Cultural Institutions generate Mojo. You'll need both to acquire City Council seats, which are how you get building permits.

Along the way, you'll also acquire Event Cards that will help you build or upgrade your Businesses and Cultural Institutions, impair those of your opponents, or influence the City Council and Building Permits.

Once the city's population reaches 1,000,000, the player with the most Mojo wins.

189846.name: Wocha
189846.description:
User summary
ウォッチャ (WOCHA) is a word game based on the traditional Japanese word game for children called しりとり (Shiritori) which literally means 尻 (buttock) 取り (grabbing). Essentially, you must make a new word (nouns only) using the last character of the previous. For example: ねこ > こま > まほう > うきよえ > えかき and so on. The game has some other simple rules to keep it controlled.

Wocha follows the pattern of Shiritori with picture cards. Each card has a complex picture that can be interpreted many ways, much as Dixit does. Players arrange ten image cards so that everyone can see them easily. Reveal one new image card from the deck to start the chain, then race to decide which one of the ten images can join the first revealed card, explaining how the two cards link together.

Each time a card is moved from the common area to link to the chain, a replacement card is drawn. Each player has four coloured cubes, and drops a cube onto a card when they make a successful link. It is allowed to revise the explanation of the chain by re-intepreting or re-using earlier cards. If a player can make a convincing argument, they can replace the previous player's cube with their own. The first player to dispose of their four cubes is the winner.

If a player makes a rather dubious interpretation on a card image, the game pauses and the players vote thumbs up or down whether to allow it. It is important to follow the rules of the word game. So in the example shown on the blog linked below, the start card was considered as たいよう (太陽 taiyou / sun) and the next card as うま (馬 uma / horse (there is a horse in the car!)), thus chaining with う. Now the current key letter would be ま from うま.

The new card drawn from the deck is a Matryoshka (マトリョーシカ). That would form a chain from うま. Then マトリョーシカ is linked by カッパ (kappa / a Yo-kai, folklore monster). Now that the key letter is パ, when you look back at that first "horse" card, that vehicle might be a パトカー (police car). This lets the player bump the blue cube off and place their own.

Publisher's summary

"Now that you mentioned it, it sure does look so." Associative skills and attentiveness is the key to this new picto-Shiritori game. The rules are simple.

Open 10 cards to form the community cards area, and give each player 4 colored tokens. Then draw 1 card from the deck, and open as the starting key card. Now, let the picture Shiritori begin!

From the 10 community cards, find a picture that can form a Shiritori-chain from the starting card. Found a good card? Call "WOCHA!"

The caller places the card next to the first card to form a chain, and places their token on the placed card. This newly placed card would be the new key. Now the players have to find a community card that can form a new Shiritori chain from the new key. Continue this procedure, and the one who gets rid of all of their tokens is the winner. But beware! The previously used cards may be reused to form a new chain. When done, the color token that was on the card would be removed and returned to the original player. So act quickly, and get rid of all your tokens before anyone attempts to return them back to you!

「言われてみれば、たしかに見える。」
連想力と発見力。新感覚の絵しりとりゲーム。
ウォッチャのルールはとってもカンタン。

全員が共通で使用する10枚のカードを机に並べ、各プレイヤーには4つのカラーコマが渡されます。
あとは、絵でしりとりをします。
山札から１枚カードをめくり、そのカードにチェーン（繋がり）出来そうなカードを場に並んだ10枚から探します。
見つけた人は「WOCHA!（ウォッチャ！）」と叫びましょう。
その人は先ほどのカードの右隣に、自分がキーワードを見つけたカードを置き、さらにその上に自分のカラーコマを置きます。
ゲームは先ほどチェーンされたカードの続きで引き続き行います。
これを繰り返し、手持ちのカラーコマ4つを誰よりも早くなくした人が勝利です。
ただし！すでに誰かが先ほどチェーンしたカードは本人以外が再度使用でき、もしそのカードを誰かが使用すると、先ほどカラーコマをせっかく置いていたのに使用された瞬間、元のプレイヤーのもとに戻ってきてしまうのです。
他のプレイヤーにカラーコマを戻される前に早く４つを手放してしまいましょう。

189847.name: Hamaritagari
189847.description:
User summary:
はまりたがり (Hamaritagari) is a real-time action game in which players compete in speed and accuracy for pattern recognition and card play. In English, 'Hamaritagari' means something like 'Those who like a perfect fit'.

You have several cats with various coat patterns, who are looking for places to be comfortable. Meet their request before everyone else by finding something into which they can comfortably fit.

A round proceeds as follows:

1) A player draws a target card from the pile and put it on the table face-up. A cat is illustrated in the card.

2) Each player races to play a card that illustrates the same cat as the target card.

3-A) The last player has no chance to score. Proceed to step 1 of the next round immediately.

3-B) The first player scores one point. Place the target card in front of you, and proceed to step 2 of the next round immediately.

3-C) The non-last players may race to steal the top card in front of the last player. Steal one point if successful. Proceed to step 2 of the next round immediately.

Steps 3-A), 3-B) and 3-C) happen simultaneously, so the next round is already in progress while resolving the current round. Players have no time to rest until the end of round ten. The highest scorer at the end of round ten wins the game.

Your pattern recognition skill and reflexes are tested during the game.

Publisher summary:
あなたの飼っている様々な模様の猫は新しいくつろぐ場所を探しています。
相手の猫よりも早くはまれる物を手に入れ猫たちの望みを叶えてあげましょう。

「はまりたがり」は、他のプレイヤーとスピードを競い合うリアルタイム系アクションゲームです。
「めくる・のせる・うばう」３つのアクションを使いこなし、勝利ポイントであるカードの獲得を目指します。
正確なカードを瞬時に探し出す能力と反射神経が試されます。

189848.description:
Description from the publisher:

Munchkin Marvel fuses the classic card game fun of monster-slaying and role-playing with the most iconic characters from the Marvel universe. Created under license from Steve Jackson Games and in conjunction with Marvel, Munchkin Marvel comes complete with new monsters (villains), allies (heroes), and custom S.H.I.E.L.D. Identification Cards.
189848.name: Munchkin Marvel
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 75- Isle of Skye and Convention Advice

189849.name: Citadel of Zushran
189849.description:
User summary:

The Citadel of Zushran provides interesting trip to the ruins of a fallen ocean empire and the dire things which remain in its capital. For levels 5-9.

Nominated as "Best Role-Playing Adventure" in the Origins
Awards for 1984.

189850.name: The Pride of Ogyane
189850.description:
User summary:

In The Pride of Ogyane the characters move into higher social circles, meeting some of the legends of Uttgart.

For characters of levels 4-8.

189851.name: The Fair at Tezkorel
189851.description:
User summary:

The Fair at Tezkorel puts the characters into a surprising
situation at a pleasant country fair.

Levels 3-7.

189852.name: The Mountains of Ikurna
189852.description:
User summary:

The Mountains of Ikurna draws the characters into some
major aspects of life in the wilds of Uttgart.

For characters of levels 2-5.

189853.name: Challenge of the Toymaker
189853.description:
User summary:

In Challenge of the Toymaker the characters must solve the twisted riddle of a demented arch-mage.

Character Levels 6-10.

189854.name: Ancient Steel Role Playing Game
rpg: Ancient Steel Fantasy Steampunk Role-Playing Game
189854.description:
Publisher's Blurb


Tired of long character making sessions in Your role playing Game? OR are you tired of role playing games that feel like and Algebra class because of all the rules to memorize? Then you need this Game. Escape to the shattered world of Cassius where magic exists alongside balloon skyships. Play as a catman, Lizard man, Human or angelic Aerion and do your part to face dangers and repair trade lines among the races.

189855.name: Double Doom
189855.description:
User summary:

Double Doom includes two adventures - one (Jaktay-Khan) among the tribe of the Khazak, and one in an evil lost temple (The Eye of Ba'al).

Both adventures are for characters level 2-5.

189856.name: Ravensgate (2nd Edition)
189856.description:
User summary:

Ravensgate provides an introduction to the slums and back alleys of Carzal, the capital of Ilchania.

For character levels 1-4.

189857.name: Demon's Pawn
189857.description:
User summary:

In Demon's Pawn characters of 4th-8th level must face down the demon lord Arekitach in his citadel to save their very souls.

189858.name: The Old Powers
189858.description:
User summary:

The Old Powers contains information on ancient forces and the creation of Ysgarth, plus information on other powerful entities.

Note this item is sometimes referred to as The Ancient Powers in advertising materials.

189859.name: The Mill on the Ibras
189859.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure is designed to be an introduction to Ysgarth for new players and should be playable using the Ysgarth Minirules and the additional material included in the adventure itself. It's also easily adapted to other roleplaying systems if you just want to get a feel for the world. The adventure is designed for a group of three players, but ought to work fine with additional players.

User summary:

The adventure was published in a usenet forum and later archived on several sites. It was presented as a black-and-white map and associated text.

189860.name: Chase 10
189860.description:
This board game without a board consists of excitement, challenges, and strategy.

This game, which is easy to play but not so easy to win, is very different than any other card game and different every time it is played.

You may have the best card at the table to win, but at the draw of the command cards, your card is gone from your hand. Who has it now? Maybe you know, maybe you don't, maybe another player knows, or maybe you can get it back in time to win!

It all depends on how the cards fall. Try it, you'll love it.

189861.name: Deuces Wild
189861.description:
Introductory Star Ace Adventure

From the introduction:

Your missile worked over that little Imperial interceptor, now a cloud of litter and dust behind you. Problem is, two Imp fighters are breathing down your neck, and your scanners tell you everyone else in your group has the same kind of unfriendly escort.

189863.name: Plentiful Food Bounty
189863.description:
In The Democratic Republic of Korea (North Korea), food is plentiful. Bluff your way through this game of taking food supplied by the Supreme Leader, but don't be greedy.

Contents:
2 Bags for sorting your plentiful bounty of food.
30 Food Tokens (Rice, Wheat, Fish, Chicken, Bread, and Vegetables)

The first player secretly takes any number of tokens from one bag and places them in the second bag. He then offers the two bags to any second player of his choice.

This player has three choices:
A) Pick one bag as his own. Then, both players count the number of tokens in their bags. The player with the most tokens (food) in their bag should be ashamed for taking more than they need and the player with the least tokens chooses a token from their bag to give to the shamed player.

If the number of tokens in each bag is equal, all the tokens must be placed in one bag and one token is drawn at random and eliminated from the game. After this is resolved, the bags should be given to another player by the second player.

B) Take both bags, move tokens, and then offer the bags to another player.

C) Take both bags, draw one random token from one bag, and pass the bags to another player.

Play repeats until three types of tokens (food) are depleted or one player accumulates 15 points.

189864.name: Peanut Farm
189864.description:
A fun, quick paced game for 3 to 4 players.

Take turns drawing and playing cards to build up (or steal!) peanut producing resources. After the deck runs out, the player with the most peanuts wins!

Takes mere minutes to learn and seconds to set up. Fun with family and friends! Simple yet with meaningful decision making.

189865.name: Caps & Hammers: A Particularly Cold War
189865.description:
We live in a world of two great nations: the Caps and the Hammers. These fierce rivals are prepared to engulf the world in their quest for prestige, influence, and domination. Take the reins of one of these mysterious powers and lead them to global Supremacy. But tread carefully, for if your ambitions run too high, you run the risk of nuclear annihilation!

Will you be able to navigate the treacherous waters of cold war diplomacy? Or will you lead the world to destruction?

The object of Caps & Hammers: A Particularly Cold War is to achieve SUPREMACY by having more supremacy points than your opponent at the end of eight rounds. Supremacy points are awarded to the players for each country and scientific project they control.

During each round, players take turns distributing a hidden action card onto the countries and scientific project in hopes of proving their superiority in every conflict. After both players have expended their cards and have revealed their plans, players gain control of the countries in which they have a higher action point sum. Players must reach the requisite eight action points to complete a project, and are constantly in a race to the next scientific milestone.

Each action card has a special effect that can turn a conflict to the player’s advantage, effects include shifting card locations, buffing action point values, stealing countries, revealing enemy plots, and etc.

Both players share a Defcon value that represents the state of war readiness of the two powers. If Defcon 1 is reached, both players must make concessions to avert nuclear conflict. Carefully spending this shared resource is essential to effective cold war strategy.

189866.name: Evolution Pulse: Echi Oscuri
189866.description:
From the back of the book:
Echi Oscuri è un’espansione per l’ambientazione Evolution Pulse, schegge di un mondo a pezzi che potrai unire formando un affresco dalle tinte oscure con cui tratteggiare il tuo mondo di gioco.

English translation:
Echi Oscuri is an expansion for the Evolution Pulse setting, shards of a broken world that you can combine to form a dark-hued fresco to outline your game world.

189867.name: Agon WW2
189867.description:
From the back of the book:
...è il giugno del 1942: l’Asse ha ormai terminato il suo slancio di distruzione, ma gli Alleati faticano a prendere la strada della riscossa finale, mentre i pochi paesi rimasti neutrali tentano di cogliere ogni vantaggio dall’instabile equilibrio che è venuto a crearsi.
Questa bolla di indecisione viene infranta quando sui cieli al centro dell’Oceano Atlantico una nave stellare viene rilevata dalle marine militari e dagli stati maggiori di tutto il globo: è la Lancia d’Argento del Popolo e porta con se la gloria della vittoria.

English translation:
..June 1942: Axis has now finished its momentum of destruction, but the Allies are struggling to take the road of the final vengeance , while the few remaining neutral countries try to take every advantage from that situation of unstable balance.
This bubble of indecision is broken when the skies in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean a starship is detected by the fleets of the entire globe: it is the Silver Spear of the People, that brings the glory fo the victory

189868.description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of Chance cards: some are for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city:some give you the option to climb a mountain:others give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks but you might pick up an option in the chance cards.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn double or triple points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
189868.name: Greece (fan expansion to Ticket to Ride)

189869.description:
In The Butterfly Garden, you are an avid butterfly collector and the local butterfly garden needs your help expanding and diversifying its collection. Capture highly desired butterflies, put them in your trusty jar, and deliver them to the garden to gain respect from the collecting community and to help diversify the garden — but watch out for your opponents as lepidopterists can be quite devious!

The game is played in a series of rounds. Players start each round by playing a card from their hands to determine the round's turn order. Cards are numbered from 0 to 59, and lower numbered cards will go first. On a turn, a player captures butterflies from the field and adds them to the jar (i.e., they take a card from the row of face-up cards and tuck it under their jar card). When possible, players "deliver butterflies" from their jars to the zoo's butterfly garden to score victory points (VPs). Which butterflies can be delivered is indicated on the face-up "delivery cards" and players are often in a race to deliver butterflies to take the cards and score points. The player with the most VPs at the end of the game wins.

During the game, players must carefully decide which butterfly cards to play. By playing lowered numbered cards, players not only get a better pick of butterflies in the field, but they also get first chance at delivering butterflies. However, lower numbered butterfly cards usually have fewer butterflies on them, so players cannot add as many to their jars. Also, butterfly cards with special powers usually have high numbers, so you often must sacrifice turn order in order to use one of these special powers.
189869.name: The Butterfly Garden
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Long View - Quick Looks #13

189870.name: Not without my donuts
189870.description:
Armies of sweet tooth obscenities flew in from the portal, while creepy, crawly spiders dropped down like paratroopers from the sky. All of your fellow cupcakes fled into the portal hoping to escape - only to never return.
There are only two of you left in Cupcake World and you’re not leaving without your donuts!

Source: The Developer Website.

189871.name: Crazy Steam Bros. 2
189871.description:
User Summary

Set variously at the end of the 19th and the start of the 20th century, this steampunk game features three heroes pitting themselves against the evil Baron. Otherwise, this is a pretty standard shoot 'em up with your craft advancing against hordes of enemies who shoot and try to run into you. There are power-ups to give you temporary skills like a shield or a laser.

189872.name: Unheard Screems - King Leopold II's Rule Over The Congo
189872.description:
Unheard Screams is a text based game with battles set in the Congo during the regime of King Leopold II of Belgium (1885-1908). As Miala, a liberating hero, the player will fight the forces of their oppressors and regain dominion of territories for the Congolese people.

Source: The Developer Website.

189874.name: Scandal the Game
189874.description: Board game based on the ABC series, Scandal. A collect and deliver type gameplay with trivia.

189875.name: Esper Force 5012
189875.description:
From the back of the book:
Anno 5012 d.C.
1057 anni dopo la Caduta della Terra. I sistemi di controllo ambientale della Necropoli iniziano ad impazzire. Un potente terremoto, seguito da un enorme tsunami devastano la città, riducendola in ginocchio. Tempeste di fulmini, gelate e siccità improvvise, il clima totalmente fuori controllo e i continui blackout finiscono il lavoro, seminando il caos nelle strade e facendo crollare ogni apparenza di ordine sociale.

English translation:
Year 5012 A.D.
1057 years after the fall of the Earth. The environmental control systems of the Necropolis start to go crazy. A powerful earthquake, followed by a huge tsunami devastated the city. Lightning storms, sudden frosts and drought, the climate out of control and rolling blackouts goes, sowing chaos in the streets and bringing down any semblance of social order .

189876.name: Who Kidnapped Princess Saralinda?
