189876.description:
From the back cover:

"The Princess Saralinda has been kidnapped!

You must find her - or the kingdom will be plunged into bloody war!"

189877.name: Brass Age Italia
189877.description:
From the back of the book:
L'Italia s'è desta”, e nulla sarà più come prima. Da nord a sud lo straniero viene scacciato dal suolo patrio e lo Stivale si avvia verso una nuova era di unità nazionale.

English translation:
Italy 's awake " , and nothing will be as before. From north to south the stranger is driven away from the land and the "Stivale" is moving towards a new era of national unity.

189878.name: Deserter Simulator
189878.description:
User Summary

Motorcycle simulator game: The goal is to get as far as possible before crashing. Build up points to upgrade.

189879.name: Doctor Who Roleplaying Game
189879.description:
From the publisher website:

Imagine you could go anywhere. This world or countless others, encountering strange alien races, new cultures or hostile environments. Now imagine you could travel to any time. Meet Robin Hood (and duel him with a spoon!), discover what terrible monster lives under your bed, journey inside a Dalek or travel to the end of time itself. Where would you go?

With Cubicle 7’s Doctor Who Roleplaying Game, the power is in your hands! You can go anywhere or anywhen in the universe. It’s not going to be easy. It’ll probably be dangerous. The universe is a hostile place, full of Daleks, Zygons, Sontarans, the Boneless, Cybermen, Clockwork Robots, Silurians and worse. There will be fear, heartbreak and excitement, but above all, it’ll be the trip of a lifetime.

The Doctor Who Roleplaying Game is a set in the universe of the world’s longest running science fiction show on TV – the BBC’s Doctor Who. This new edition of the rulebook, fully updated with imagery from the Twelfth Doctor’s adventures, presents all the rules and background you need to have your own adventures in time and space in a single volume, including:

A complete set of rules for playing the game.
Rules for creating your own characters, gadgets and more.
A guide to creating your own adventures, as well as two new adventures.
Ready-made character sheets for the Twelfth Doctor and his companions, including Clara Oswald, Danny Pink, Madame Vastra, Jenny and Strax.
Rules and background for some of the Doctor’s most infamous enemies – including Missy!
All-new imagery from the Twelfth Doctor's adventures.
And much more besides!




The Doctor Who Roleplaying Game has been written to appeal to both the experienced and first-time gamer. The game is suitable for 2 or more players aged 10 to 2000.

189880.description:
After the Agency executed Omega Protocol, Subterra Bravo was nothing but a smoldering crater. We thought there were no survivors. We were wrong. Dr. Cronos is at large. A new team of Agency commandos, call sign Tin Man, has tracked the rogue alien to a secret research facility in Russia. Their mission: exterminate. Meanwhile, Cronos has revived Russian experiments incorporating Ghin technology. In his new Russian collaborators he has found the means to protect his nefarious research.

To reach Cronos, the commandos will first have to go through his army of Spetznaz and confront a new genetically engineered nightmare. But Tin Man has a hulking mech suit bristling with weapons and high-tech capabilities, as well as an unlikely ally in Thoth, a Ghin scientist with powerful psychotronic abilities and the sworn enemy of Dr. Cronos.

Extreme Prejudice is an adrenaline-fueled expansion for LEVEL 7 [OMEGA PROTOCOL], a semi-cooperative board game of miniatures-based tactical combat for 2–6 players. Includes five new scenarios, three new enemy types, and two new commandos.
189880.name: Level 7 [Omega Protocol]: Extreme Prejudice

189881.name: Popeye's Spinach Hunt Game
189881.description:
The Object of Popeye's Spinach Hunt Game is to be the first player to collect all six different colored spinach treasure cards and return to his/her start space.

In this 2 to 4 player game, players start in the corner space of their chosen color. Spin the Popeye spinner and move your boat token the exact number shown. On the way around the board, collect different colored treasure chests filled with spinach. If you land on a Brutus space, you must put back one of your spinach treasure chests and collect it again. To collect treasure chests, you must land (by exact count) on the treasure chest spaces (marked with an X) on the board.

The first player to collect treasure chests of all six different colors and then lands (by exact count) on his/her starting space, wins the game.

boardgamecompilation: For the Crown Expansion #1: Shock & Awe
For the Crown Expansion #3: Between Heaven and Earth
For the Crown: Vanguard Promo Pack
189882.description:
The For the Crown: Sceptered Bundle includes the following:

For the Crown (Second edition)
Shock and Awe (Expansion #1)
Between Heaven and Earth (Expansion #3)
the Vanguard Promo Pack
189882.name: For the Crown: Sceptered Bundle

189883.description: The For the Crown: Vanguard Promo Pack is a set of 12 new cards (2 each of 6 different cards) and 20 units (which are mostly the 4 new unit types recruitable with the new cards) for For the Crown. It was initially offered as part of the Sceptered Bundle.
189883.name: For the Crown: Vanguard Promo Pack

189884.description: The Wombat Rescue: 5th Player Expansion does exactly what its name suggests: It expands Wombat Rescue to support 5 players (the rules for a 5-player game are included in the base game's rulebook, along with the rules for the other expansions that were available upon release of the game). This was the final stretch goal for the Kickstarter campaign, and that stretch goal was not met; however, it is available for purchase through the publisher's website.
189884.name: Wombat Rescue: 5th Player Expansion
boardgamefamily: Guild: Game Designers of North Carolina

189885.name: BRAWL (2015)
189885.description:
User Summary

This action game is heir to the Bomberman games. There are eight campaigns for each of the eight character to choose from, each with its own special abilities. The horror theme is quite dark. There are a variety of arena styles to choose for multiplayer mode.

189886.name: True or False
189886.description: Card came with two true or false questions per card. Questioner reads both, decides which is less likely to be answered correctly and asks that question. If the answerer answers correctly the point and card go to the answerer. If the answer is incorrect the card/point stays with the questioner.

189887.name: Jail Break
189887.description:
Jail Break is a card-based strategic tabletop game that pits you against your friends in a race to escape the world's most dangerous prison.

The game runs 2-6 players and a session can last from 20-40 mins. Your goal is to navigate through the prison in an attempt to gain three resources (blueprint, keycard, too) and then head to the room identified on your blueprint to escape.

But this prison will be unforgiving. With every turn you will have to contend with gang attacks, fellow inmates trying to escape, and officers looking to send you to solitary confinement.

Jail Break is dynamic because you draw a unique mugshot profile, that provides you with a special skill set to use throughout the match in every match. The prison layout will also change with every session (as it is made up from cards) creating a different game each time you play.

189888.name: Wicked Words! (Vol 2, Issue 7 - Mar 2015)
rpgissue: Wicked Words! A Magazine For The Discriminating Gamer
189888.description:
User summary:

This issue contains a "Play Dirty" column, fiction, and articles on Vancian magic systems and ninjas.

189889.name: Wicked Words! (Vol 2, Issue 8 - Jun 2015)
rpgissue: Wicked Words! A Magazine For The Discriminating Gamer
189889.description:
User summary:

This issue contains a "Play Dirty" column and articles on Santa Vaca and Houses of the Blooded.

189890.name: Scrimish Card Game
189890.description:
Scrimish is a fast moving card game that pits player against player in an epic 10 minute battle of strategy, memory, and misdirection. Every game is different, and you'll want to play over and over again to try new ways of outsmarting your opponent. The game is expandable to large team or free-for-all games.

The objective of the game is to uncover and attack your opponent’s Crown Card with one of your own cards. Each player places 5 piles of 5 cards each face down in from of them. The crown card should be hidden on the bottom of one of the 5 piles. The rest of the cards may be arranged however you like, but choose carefully. A bad setup can quickly give your opponent the upper hand.

Game play: Players take turns attacking by selecting the top Card from one of their Piles and laying that Card face up in front of one of their opponent’s Piles. The defending player must then reveal the top Card of the Pile that was attacked. The Card with the lowest number value loses and is discarded. The winning Card must be returned face down to the top of the original Pile it was drawn from. If the two Cards have the same number value, both Cards are discarded. Play continues until one of the players attacks their opponent’s Crown Card, winning the game.

Special cards:
Archer Card: If you attack with an Archer Card, it always wins. If your Archer Card is attacked, it always loses. Shield Card: Shield Cards cannot be used to attack. If your Shield Card is attacked, both your Shield Card and your opponent’s attacking Card are discarded (except for Archer Cards - see Additional Rules. Crown Card: You can attack with your Crown Card. If you attack your opponent’s Crown Card, you win. Otherwise, you lose the game

189891.description: Sets of 90 ship bases for Exodus: Proxima Centauri and Exodus: Edge of Extinction
189891.name: Exodus: Proxima Centauri Ship Bases

189894.name: Thea: The Awakening
189894.description:
hea: The Awakening is a turn-based strategic survival game steeped in Slavic myth and monstrosity set after an apocalyptic force known only as The Darkness has engulfed the world. There are Strigas and Baba Yagas aplenty, but there are no heroes, no monster slayers, and no great armies capable of banishing them. You have only a few hopeless and starving survivors who are desperately trying to stay alive. You are their last and only true hope!

The game combines turn-based strategic gameplay with the tension and grit of a rogue-like, a captivating story you can uncover through a series of in-game events, and a unique combat system based on a complex card battle game.

The wide range of gameplay features allows you to proceed through the world of Thea the way you prefer. You can choose to stay in your village and build up defenses, or you can go out and explore the world. Conflicts can be resolved through assassination, stealth, diplomacy, hunting, and various other ways depending on the skills your people possess. Fighting is not your only solution to conflict!

Source: The Developer Website.

189895.name: Stasis
videogamehonor: 2015 Global Game Awards Best Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Global Game Awards Best Horror Game of the Year Nominee
189895.description:
Stasis is a 2015 science fiction horror point-and-click adventure game developed by The Brotherhood. Viewed from an isometric perspective, the game requires interactions with computers, combining items and puzzle solving. The game was released on 31 August 2015 for the Microsoft Windows and Mac OS X, with Linux and mobile devices planned for future release.

The game centers around the main character John Maracheck who awakes from Stasis aboard an abandoned spaceship. Maracheck must unravel the mysteries aboard the spaceship "Groomlake" to find his missing wife and daughter, before the spaceship plunges further into Neptune's methane clouds.

Source: Wikipedia, "Stasis (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

189896.name: Divinity: Original Sin II
videogamehonor: 2014 Global Game Awards Best Co-op Game of the Year Nominee
2014 Global Game Awards Best PC Exclusive Game of the Year Nominee
2014 Global Game Awards Best RPG of the Year Nominee
2014 Global Game Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2017 PAX Curse Award Best RPG of the Year Winner
189896.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Divinity: Original Sin 2 is an role-playing video game developed and published by Larian Studios, the sequel to 2014's Divinity: Original Sin.

The player will be able to choose their character's stats, race and origin story. They can recruit up to three companions to assist them. The companions can become playable characters in multiplayer modes. Up to 4 players can compete or assist each other in multiplayer. The player can manipulate the environment to their advantage. Dialogue and quests would be different, depending on the characters' backstory. There will be a skill crafting system to allow the player the mix and change their skills. A cover system is also featured and can be used in combat. The game would also feature a system called "Love & Hate". It allows players to establish friendship, romantic relationship and hatred towards other characters.

Source: Wikipedia, "Divinity: Original Sin 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

189897.name: Wizard: The Christmas Wizards
189897.description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 15.

The four wizards in festive garb replace the usual wizard cards in your Wizard deck. Obviously, they are particularly suited for play during the holiday season. The rules remain the same.

There is also an 8 wizard variant.

189898.name: Marine Park Empire
189898.description:
Get ready to jump in the water as you run the most exciting and wild marine park ever in the latest and greatest sea-life simulation!

Control every aspect of your marine park, from caring, feeding and cleaning your animals to hiring and firing employees. Grant your visitors the thrill of a lifetime as you provide fun-filled attractions, rides and shows for them to whet their appetite while they explore your sea-life wonderland.

Featuring a free-form game where you set the rules, and a challenging non-linear scenario mode where you can test your skills at becoming next great saltwater specialist, the fun and varied gameplay in Marine Park will not leave gamers out to dry.

Maintain your checkbook balances afloat, keep your denizens of the deep delighted and the visitors flowing in your park. Then dive in for wave after wave of aquatic fun!

Source: The Publisher Website.

189900.name: Ghost Knights of Camelot
189900.description:
From publisher blurb:

The kingdom is threatened once again, this time by the ghosts of past champions, guided my a mysterious evil....

189901.name: Revenge of the Falcon Knight
189901.description:
From publisher blurb:

While being exiled by the king, Sir Ashley, the Falcon Knight, proclaims his innocence and begs you to clear his name. There's a traitor to root out!

189902.description:
Space Pioneers is a competitive card game which is set in a new discovered planetary system. Players lay out supply networks with their planet and spaceship cards. The cards have to be placed adjacent to other cards according to the placing rules. Thus everybody lays out their own supply network and tries to collect planets. A planet can be collected from the supply network if a player builds a new route with the same planet. That means the planet has to be laid out a second (or third or more often) time and then the old planet card(s) have to be taken as victory point(s).

Every player has got a mission card (with 4 missions) and a top secret card (with 2 tasks). The missions are all the same for each player, for example: "place a planet at the supply network from another player". This is possible but harder than placing a planet in the own system. It also could hurt the other player but would not destroy his/her whole plan.

Mission cards are placed open, so every player knows always how much missions the other players have solved. The secret tasks are all different and the players hide them till the end of the game. Only then the players show them and thus the secret tasks could be crucial for determining the winner.
189902.name: Space Pioneers
boardgamepodcastepisode: PNPCAST 011: Argo & Space Pioneers

boardgamecompilation: VivaJava: The Coffee Game: The Dice Game - Game of the Year Expansion
189903.description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 14.

4 cardboard tokens:

INSTANT-KAFFEE "Sweetener Scandal"
ABER BITTE MIT SAHNE! "Creamer"
MUCKEFUCK! "Lukewarm"
HÜTCHENSPIELER "Ability Swap"




Tokens are in German.

These tokens are also contained in "VivaJava: The Coffee Game: The Dice Game - Game of the Year Expansion" but in English.
189903.name: VivaJava: Al Gusto - Promotableau NR. 1

189904.description:
Description from the publisher:

Now that one of Gomorra's biggest players has fallen ill, the race is on to find a cure for a sickness that has been plaguing the entire town. Can Pasteur find it in time?

Doomtown: Reloaded – Foul Play, the eighth Saddlebag Expansion, features a complete playset of 21 new cards to customize your Doomtown decks. Foul Play contains all new ways to stick it to your opponent in your battle to control the town!
189904.name: Doomtown: Reloaded – Foul Play

189905.name: Doomtown: Reloaded – Bad Medicine
189905.description:
Description from the publisher:

Doomtown: Reloaded – Bad Medicine is the ninth Saddlebag expansion for Doomtown: Reloaded.

189906.name: Challenge of the Wolf Knight
189906.description:
From publisher blurb:

King Henry's cousin is coming to visit, but before he does, you have been asked to make the countryside safe by investigating tales of a mysterious wolf-headed knight.

189907.name: The Dragon Queen's Revenge
189907.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dragon queen has returned! And she wants revenge! You must defeat the armies of the Dragon Queen- before she conquers the kingdom!

189909.name: Tournament for Terror
189909.description:
From publisher blurb:

One fine spring day, a golden knight appears out of nowhere, to challenge and humiliate the king's knights. While this is happening, the castle's treasury is looted!

189910.name: The Impostor King
189910.description:
From publisher blurb:

King Henry has been acting mighty strange lately. The Wizard and Warrior realize that this is because he's been replaced with an imposter!

189911.name: The Scarlet Shield of Shalimar
189911.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beladar the Barbarian has stolen Merlin's magic shield. With it, his evil is unstoppable- but stop him you must!

189912.name: Carnival of Demons
189912.description:
From publisher blurb:

Evil spirits have brought the past back to threaten the kingdom's future! You must search out the evil sorceress and destroy her demon troops- even though it means you must journey into the perilous unknown of time!

189913.name: Attack on the King
189913.description:
From publisher blurb:

The King has been stabbed- and lies near death! You must find his attacker and fight the awesome mysterious powers that propel this fiend to such unspeakable evil.

189914.name: Warrior Women of Weymouth
189914.description:
From publisher blurb:

The kingdom has been attacked by women warriors - who fight with twice the power of mortal men! It's up to you to find these fiendish females and defeat them.

189915.name: Goosebumps Web of Mystery Gigantik Game
189915.description:
Enter if you dare! There is a mystery to be solved. Someone has stolen ans hidden one of the Mystery Goosebumps Disks. Become one of your favorite Goosebumps characters and try to solve which of the Mystery Goosebumps Disks is missing and you win the game. Beware you're in for a scare!

Mix up all 20 disks, choose a Goosebumps Mystery Disk and place the 19 remaining (number side facing down) in center of playmat. Place chosen Goosebumps Mystery Disk in the box (number side facing down) and close the lid.
Each player gets a checklist sheet from checklist pad to check off the Goosebumps Mystery Disks they have collected. The first player to correctly guess which Goosebumps Mystery Disk is hidden inside the box wins.
You take a Goosebumps Mystery Disk when you land on Spider Spaces. You'll put a check mark next to that Goosebumps Mystery Disk on your checklist.
There are also Switch List Spaces, Tombstone Spaces and R.I.P. Spaces. Tombstone spaces are safe, nothing happens. Some might have roll again on them. R.I.P. Spaces on it, you lose a turn. Switch List Spaces, the player switches their checklist with player of their choice and marks down the Mystery Disks they've already collected.

189916.name: Fall of Magic
rpghonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2015 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode 54 - Fall of Magic, Cheat Your Own Adventure, Witch: The Road to Lindisfarne
189916.description:
From the Rulebook:

Magic is dying, and the Magus is dying with it. We travel together to the realm of the Umbra where magic was born.

Fall of Magic is a collaborative storytelling game where we play as a group of travellers in the company of the Magus. On the way, we'll encounter stranger hosts, fantastic places, and perilous choices as we play to discover who our characters are, how they relate, and how our journey changes them.

189917.name: Doctor Who: The Card Game – Twelfth Doctor Expansion One
189917.description:
Description from the publisher:

Doctor Who: The Card Game – Twelfth Doctor Expansion One contains 42 new cards from the Twelfth Doctor's adventures, from Madame Vastra and Strax to Missy and the Boneless. It also contains all the rules, components, counters and cards you need to play the game with five players, too.

189919.name: Doctor Who: The Card Game – Classic Doctor Edition
189919.description:
Description from the publisher:

Daleks, Cybermen, The Master – The list of threats is endless and no place in the universe is ever truly safe from danger, but there is one man who has made it his mission to defend the defenseless, help the helpless, and save everyone he can: a mysterious stranger, a force of nature who has seen his own planet die, a madman with a box.

In Doctor Who: The Card Game – Classic Doctor Edition, players act as the Doctor and his companions to defend specific locations while sending the Doctor's enemies to conquer locations your opponents are trying to protect. Each player starts the game with one location, and cards in the deck consist of attackers, defenders, locations and support cards. To start a turn, you draw two cards, pick up any cards banked from a previous turn, and take the three cards passed to you earlier by the player on your left. You play or bank cards until you have only three in hand, then pass those to the player on your right and end your turn.

Attackers target specific locations and earn points for the player wielding them if they're in play at the end of the game. Defenders try to remove attackers so that the location owner scores points for protecting the location. Support cards provide different abilities, such as enlarging your bank or providing time points (which can be used to draw additional cards). Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins!

Doctor Who: The Card Game – Classic Doctor Edition can be combined with Doctor Who: The Card Game.

189920.name: Victory's Vault Volume 2, Issue 04
189920.description:
From publisher blurb:


"Every Item Touched by Victory!"

The "good" Lady Nike Wondderra claims to be the keeper of the vaults of the goddess of Victory, and in the pages of Victory's Vault, she offers these items to adventurers and villains alike at remarkable prices! Each installment of Victory's Vaults includes...

A fine selection of weapons of the Era
A unique item of armor
A vehicle the suit the needs of hero and/or villain
A "white elephant," such as a new animal, a playable Package, some new Special Abilities, or a place to explore and perhaps purchase!




Also includes some notes on how Lady Wonderra pitches these fine items, and the potential benefits (or consequences!) of haggling. Want more stuff? You can't do much better than to look in Victory's Vault!

189921.name: Ruins of Trostenhal: Kings Hall
189921.description:
From publisher blurb:

Long ago the Dwarves of Trostenhal were famous throughout the Fourteen Kingdoms as smiths, weaponmasters and runemages. People travelled to the grand hold of Trostenhal and the trade made the Dwarves wealthy and respected. What happened to ruin this is unclear - the scribes still struggle to piece together the accounts - but what is clear is that a huge cataclysm shook the mountain and destroyed Trostenhal, allowing the ice and frost to claim the ruined hold for it's own. Now only rubble and snow fill the lonely corridors, and perhaps the ghosts of those that lived and died there.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. The map can be used as a standalone battlemap, or combined with the rest of the Trostenhal set.

Contents: A 20 x 20 map depicting the frozen Kings Hall of a ruined Dwarven hold. Huge columns have fallen over the Royal Seal, and a chasm has opened up through some of the rooms. The throne room is filled with rubble and ice, although the grand Throne of the King sits surprisingly untouched at the top of a dais.

189922.name: Ruins of Trostenhal: Feast Hall
189922.description:
From publisher blurb:

Long ago the Dwarves of Trostenhal were famous throughout the Fourteen Kingdoms as smiths, weaponmasters and runemages. People travelled to the grand hold of Trostenhal and the trade made the Dwarves wealthy and respected. What happened to ruin this is unclear - the scribes still struggle to piece together the accounts - but what is clear is that a huge cataclysm shook the mountain and destroyed Trostenhal, allowing the ice and frost to claim the ruined hold for it's own. Now only rubble and snow fill the lonely corridors, and perhaps the ghosts of those that lived and died there.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. The map can be used as a standalone battlemap, or combined with the rest of the Trostenhal set.

Contents: A 20 x 20 map depicting the frozen Feast Hall of a ruined Dwarven hold. The stone tables and benches are still set with plates and pitchers, whilst a huge crack has ripped through the kitchen area and the Hall. Barrels and columns have fallen, as has part of the wall to reveal the caverns beyond.

189923.name: Ruins of Trostenhal: Entrance
189923.description:
From publisher blurb:

Long ago the Dwarves of Trostenhal were famous throughout the Fourteen Kingdoms as smiths, weaponmasters and runemages. People travelled to the grand hold of Trostenhal and the trade made the Dwarves wealthy and respected. What happened to ruin this is unclear - the scribes still struggle to piece together the accounts - but what is clear is that a huge cataclysm shook the mountain and destroyed Trostenhal, allowing the ice and frost to claim the ruined hold for it's own. Now only rubble and snow fill the lonely corridors, and perhaps the ghosts of those that lived and died there.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. The map can be used as a standalone battlemap, or combined with the rest of the Trostenhal set.

Contents: A 20 x 20 map depicting the frozen entrance to a ruined Dwarven hold. Wintery trees grow near the large steps, leading into a vast chamber. Rubble and fallen statues litter the ground, and various doors lead off to sealed rooms or deeper into the Hold.

189924.name: Combat Accelerator
189924.description:
From publisher blurb:

The evening got thrown off and is going slow because a minor combat got really, really bogged down... It has happend to all of us at some point. The Combat Accelerator can help keep this from happening in your D00 Lite, Bare Bones Fantasy, Covert Ops and other games. You can use this most of the time (or all of the time) and save the full blown ultra detailed combats for when you really want them.

189925.description:
"Uri, vinciri, verberari, ferroque necari"

"I will resist, to be burned, tied, beaten, to die by sword"

The Coliseo is the throbing heart of Rome and as a "lanista", owner of "ludus", you will train and pay for the greatest champion of the arena that will serve and fight for you and your honor. Auctions will take place to sell the best fighters. You will have the chance to develop your infrastructures and set combats. Each victory for your "ludus" is a line written in History.

The main objective of Ludi Gladiatory is to achieve 7 points of Fame and Glory. This is gained by either making your "Ludum" bigger or by wining combats. You have at your disposal several gladiators that you can either sell, order to build or to fight.
Another section are combats with a drawing damage cards system.
189925.name: Ludi Gladiatorii

189926.name: The Temple of Jewels and Mirrors (5E)
189926.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition compatible adventure for four to five level player characters.

Carlyetta Wesleigh once again seeks the PCs' help to restore the earth temple of the Great Mother, which stands as testament to the ancient bond between the halflings and dwoerg of Picollo.

The last temple of the goddess to be abandoned during the Hoyrall Wars, the Temple of Jewels and Mirrors, has been sealed for hundreds of years. From the nearby dwoerg city of Stoneroot a team of brave companions sets forth to prepare the site for sanctification by the priests of the newly-revived Devotees of the Four Hearts. Ignorance, deception, and the resurgence of a threat long thought eliminated from the shores of Picollo combine to frustrate the efforts of the intrepid band.

Also Included in this Adventure:

Richly detailed relationships with recurring NPCs.
Five new monsters, the Zagnatti: a race spawned from the mind of an alien god.
A method to track the PCs' influence on the future development of Picollan society.
Notes on scaling for parties of 6 or more.

189927.name: The Ties that Bind (5E)
rpgissuearticle: Roll for Review: Shattered Heart #1 – The Ties that Bind
189927.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition compatible adventure for four to five 6th level player characters.

A genesis of fellowship for four to five 6th level player characters.

Still reeling from the twin disasters of the Great Schism and the Hoyrall Wars, the halfings of Picollo are a people cast adrift from ancient traditions. A cleric of the Great Mother strives to restore four great holy sites to the goddess, and in doing so restore the bedrock of halfling society.

The PCs leave the snow-swept plains of the Klavek Kingdom for the warm shores of distant Picollo to restore the first of these great temples, being among the very few permitted to access to the closed-off island. Bigotry, bribery, deal-making, and self-interest prove just as challenging to overcome as flesh and blood obstacles. Sea monsters, raiders' and ancient traps at mystical sites all test the PCs’ skill before they slip under the waves to confront the corruption at the heart of the water temple of the Great Mother.

Also Included in this Adventure:

Richly detailed relationships with recurring NPCs.
Politics, mystery and skill challenges to test the players’ (and PCs’) versatility.
A method to track the PC’s influence on the future development of Picollan society.
A new minor artifact and an ancient magical boon.
Notes on scaling for parties of 6 or more.
Maps by 5e cartographer Jared Blando.

189928.name: Polaris Six
189928.description:
From publisher blurb:

Polaris Six is an EPOCH Christmas Special; a one-shot survival horror scenario with all proceeds being donated to children in need through the United NaEPOCH Christmas Specialtions Children's Fund (UNICEF).

The Polaris Project is looking for exceptional individuals ready for their next great challenge. Polaris Six is a floating research station built on an Arctic ice floe. Equipped with cutting edge technology this is a unique opportunity to be part of a small team researching oceanology, meteorology, geophysics and marine biology. Polaris Six is also studying how people interact and work together in harsh environments so every member of staff, regardless of their role, will be contributing to a range of world-leading research. You will be a highly motivated, resourceful, team-player with proven technical or scientific expertise. Successful applicants will begin residence on Polaris Six in November.

189929.name: Bitardia
189929.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

A very distinct looking FPS/adventure game. Apparently based on Russian imageboard culture.

189930.name: Infinite Armor 2
189930.description:
From publisher blurb:

Well, if you have the guns and the gear, you need armor to back up your claims of badness! Thus you will find in this book all kinds of armor to keep yourself protected when fighting. Go buy all the stuff, strap them on, and conquer the universe.

Compatible with Infinite Futures 2.0 and other science fiction realms.

189931.name: Arcana Journal (Issue 79 - Dec 2015)
189931.description:
From publisher blurb:

The true wonders of Arcana are explored in the monthly journals. Each issue focuses on a hex or faction within the game world, offering rumors, hidden lore, and detailed descriptions of all the important sites and people. Full-color maps (also offered in print-easy black and white) are provided, plus all sites of worthwhile note, such as towns and major adventure sites. Floor plans of castles and other location are also offered.

In addition to this detailed write-up, each issue will also focus on other aspects of the game world, its history, important people, the Magi and gaming classes. When you add it all up, these journals take the mundane and make it magical. It is through the journals that the Arcana game world will grow, expand, and become a living place of adventure.

This issue of the Journal will cover the following aspects of the game world.

House Halbrock
School of Dark Arts

189932.description:
Tyrants of the Underdark is a territory control game with a deck-building element.

Each player leads a house of Drow in a section of the Underdark below the Sword Coast. The Drow house is represented by a deck of cards, with each card being a minion in that player's deck. Each minion belongs to one of five aspects of Drow society, and those aspects correspond to different strategies in the game, e.g., malice minions excel at assassinating opponents' troops, while ambition minions are best at recruiting additional minions and promoting minions to your "inner circle", which is a special zone that increases their value at the end of the game.

When you set up the game, you create an 80-card deck by shuffling two 40-card half-decks together, with the half-decks being Drow, Dragons, Demons, and Elemental Evil.

A central marketplace has new minions that can be recruited through influence, one of two resources in the game; purchased cards are placed in your discard pile, then shuffled together with other cards in your deck when needed. The other resource is power, which allows you to place troops on the game board, expand your forces across the map of the Underdark, manipulate happenings in the city, and assassinate enemy troops.

Players gain points by controlling sites, recruiting valuable minions, promoting minions to your inner circle, and assassinating troops, and whoever ends the game with the most points wins.
189932.name: Tyrants of the Underdark
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 010 – Our 2016 Wishlist
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 022 – Origins 2016
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 035 – Top 25 of 2016
Deckbuilder Review Special
Episode 23 - The Social Contract Of Gaming
Episode 3: Above and Below, The Oracle of Delphi, Gruff, Tyrants of The Underdark, Biblios
Episode 76- The Networks and Origins 2016
Origins
RDTN Episode 97: Reviews of Tyrants of the Underdark, Simurgh, Mystic Vale, My Village, Tides of Madness and Others
Strange Assembly 190 - GenCon 2016 Preview
Strange Assembly 192 - Live From GenCon 2016
Strange Assembly 205 - 2016 Wrap-Up
The Dice Steeple #18 - Mike Fitzgerald Interview
The Game Pit: Episode 68 - Picking Over the Bones
The Good The Board and The Forgehaven: Episode 98 “Interview with Isaac Childres”
Tyrants of the Underdark, Games We Don't Mind Losing - Boards & Swords #78

189933.name: Superhero
189933.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pop character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

189934.name: Kappa
189934.description:
From publisher blurb:

A "Ruin" character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

189935.name: Loremaster
189935.description:
From publisher blurb:

A "Ruin" character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

189936.name: Yeti
189936.description:
From publisher blurb:

A "Ruin" character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

189937.name: Gnoll
189937.description:
From publisher blurb:

A fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

189938.name: Harpy
189938.description:
From publisher blurb:

A fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

189939.name: Pirate
189939.description:
From publisher blurb:

A fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

189940.name: Troll
189940.description:
From publisher blurb:

A fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

189941.name: CASH Trader
189941.description:
In CASH Trader, you are a Day Trader/Investor trying to make one million dollars before your opponents can make theirs.

Accumulate wealth by adding new CASH Profit cards to your Trading Firm. Be sure to invest wisely as some CASH cards are more valuable than others, but carry greater risk.
There is more to making money than collecting CASH cards as Venture Capital, Dividend Yield and Premium Earning all playing their part in maximizing your wealth. Beware, however, the Bankers and Brokers, who have their eyes on your CASH.

The game changes with each turn as each player has the power to send you to Jail, start a Global Recession, force you into Bankruptcy or just simply steal you CASH.

CASH Trader is an attack-strategy card game of deceit, risk, trickery, economic management and sharp negotiation skills for two to eight players, ages 12 and up.

189942.name: Fighting Fantasy: Caverns of the Snow Witch
189942.description:
Travel to Northern Allansia’s perilous Icefinger Mountains to defeat the wicked Snow Witch in this Fighting Fantasy adventure!

"Deep within the Crystal Caves of Icefinger Mountains, the dreaded Snow Witch is plotting to bring on a new ice age. A brave trapper dies in your arms and lays the burden of his mission on your shoulders. But time is running out – will YOU take up the challenge?"

Originally written by Ian Livingstone in 1984, Caverns of the Snow Witch celebrates its 30th anniversary in 2014. The ninth book in the Fighting Fantasy series, it expands upon the original version published in WARLOCK magazine, taking you beyond the Crystal Caves. In celebration of the 30th anniversary, all-new colour artwork by a variety of artists has been included.

Source: The Developer Website.

189943.name: Loonacy: Game Trade Magazine Expansion
189943.description: An expansion for Loonacy containing five new cards featuring the GTM logo paired with images from the game. This expansion was included in issue #168 of Game Trade Magazine

189944.description:
At its core, The Bermuda Crisis: Discovery Dawning is a free-form card game about skill acquisition and management. Players accomplish this by drawing resources they then spend to obtain various abilities.

Over time you'll use the various resources you've collected to build and upgrade base camps. These camps specialize in (1) defense & resource efficiency, (2) game control & magic, and (3) trading & secret missions. Striking a balance between focus and diversification is the biggest challenge players will face.

You win the game by acquiring victory points, but there are two alternate endings. As the game progresses, an imaginary hourglass counts down the island's doom. If time runs out, a victor is chosen via the collection of "nature points." The third way a game can end is if a player collects all three pieces of Brinehorn's Scroll, which are scattered randomly throughout the island and unlock the esoteric history of The Bermuda Triangle. Both alternate scenarios create palpable suspense as players race towards their preferred ending.

Ultimately, The Bermuda Crisis: Discovery Dawning is easy to learn but challenging to master. It appeals to different personality types and finishes on an exhilarating note. You and your gaming comrades will want to explore the island time and time again!
189944.name: The Bermuda Crisis: Discovery Dawning (Second Edition)

189945.name: Nucleus Player Quick Start Guide (Version 5)
189945.description:
For Nucleus Version 5 and above

From the introduction:

This guide is meant to provide an overview of the core Nucleus rules and character creation for new players. It is deliberately brief, for a more detailed overview see [the other game materials].

189946.name: Nucleus Character Generator (Version 5)
189946.description:
User summary:

For Nucleus Version 5 and above, the character generator is implemented in Microsoft Excel as an XLS with data and formulas that partially automate and error-check the rather complicated character creation process.

The workbook has several tabs and cells are color-coded to indicate basic function (e.g., data entry, coded values, or derived values).

189947.name: Civil Unrest
189947.description:
From the Cherry Picked Games site:

The Human-Demon War has pushed America to its breaking point. Two new nations have emerged to combat the horde, though their ideological differences fuel strife despite our species' suffering. "Civil Unrest" follows the players' journey as neutral mercenaries trying to preserve these fragile alliances.

This guide aids game masters in directing a Catalyst campaign. "Civil Unrest" takes 3-5 players through a shorter, 4-session campaign.

189948.description:
From the publisher:

Can you survive the waves of ferocious Dunlendings that assail you from all sides with The Dunland Trap Nightmare Deck? Its new encounter cards force you even further back on the defensive as you stumble into a Dunlending ambush. New enemies and treachery cards reinforce the original scenario's design adding new effects that trigger when you draw cards, as well as others that discard the cards you've just drawn, forcing you to draw more. Meanwhile, several new locations offer the scenario's Dunland enemies a measure of cover that makes it harder to damage them in the staging area and harder to avoid.

Nightmare Decks for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game allow you to revisit your favorite scenarios cast in the shadows of the game's challenging Nightmare Mode. Featuring deadlier enemies, darker locations, and more terrifying surprises, each Nightmare Deck introduces new, alternate encounter cards and instructions for using them to reshape a scenario's encounter deck. The result? A nightmarish journey through territory you thought you knew, but with twists and turns that will have you on the edge of your seat!
189948.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: The Dunland Trap
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

189949.description:
From the publisher:

In The Three Trials, your heroes must recover the powerful Dunlending artifact, The Antlered Crown. However, to recover it in Nightmare Mode, they'll first have to survive the deadly challenges presented them by three Guardian enemies. The Three Trials Nightmare Deck brings these challenges more fully into focus with new Spirit enemies that both give strength to and gain strength from the Guardian enemies that share their totems.

Nightmare Decks for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game allow you to revisit your favorite scenarios cast in the shadows of the game's challenging Nightmare Mode. Featuring deadlier enemies, darker locations, and more terrifying surprises, each Nightmare Deck introduces new, alternate encounter cards and instructions for using them to reshape a scenario's encounter deck. The result? A nightmarish journey through territory you thought you knew, but with twists and turns that will have you on the edge of your seat!
189949.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: The Three Trials
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

189950.description:
From the publisher:

Decades ago an apocalypse destroyed the world, wrecking its cities, ravaging the land, and devastating the population. Now, after more than a generation, a new age dawns with The Cataclysm, an expansion for Talisman Revised 4th Edition. People are returning to establish settlements, nature is evolving in bizarre, unprecendented ways, and traces of the former civilization can be found everywhere. This is a time of chaos and possibility, of challenges and heroism.

The Cataclysm introduces a new center board that opens up a reinvented, post-apocalyptic realm for your exploration. Those brave enough to inhabit this world are brought to life in the Denizens deck, while the Remnants deck fills spaces with lost treasures, broken artifacts, and the lingering after-effects of the apocalypse. Five more characters now seek the Crown of Command, including the Black Knight who once menaced the Middle Region, and four alternative endings shape your quests in this ever-changing world.

Changed Characters

Some of the Characters who first sought the Crown of Command may undertake that quest again in this altered, post-apocalyptic world. Competing with them in The Cataclysm are five others who have never sought it before. Some of them have long inhabited the realm. For instance, the Black Knight has abandoned his castle in the Middle Region to claim greater power. He now rides through Talisman, forcing the other Characters he meets to give him gold or else he’ll take one of their lives. The Mutant has also lived in this realm her whole life, and also remained there through its darkest times, but she is no longer the human that she once was. Magical energies that flared and fluctuated during the apocalypse infected her body so thoroughly that her form, Strength, Craft, and fate have continually changed.

Others have no memories of what it was like before the apocalypse. The Scavenger grew up during the decades that followed and learned how to survive by staying in motion and collecting whatever Objects she could find. The most valuable ones she stashes away so that they cannot be stolen. Youngest of all is the Arcane Scion , born during the outburst of magical energies that transformed the Mutant. Unlike the Mutant, who cannot fully control her mutations, the Arcane Scion has harnessed those energies, using them to wield Magic Objects and cast Spells.
189950.name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Cataclysm Expansion

189952.description:
From the publisher:

Your desperate chase through the streets of Tharbad becomes even more harrowing within the shadows of Nightmare Mode! As it takes you back to a city full of the Dark Lord's spies, the Trouble in Tharbad Nightmare Deck greatly amplifies the scenario's challenge and its suspense. Your enemies will chase you so closely, you'll just about feel hot Orc breath on the back of your neck.

Nightmare Decks for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game allow you to revisit your favorite scenarios cast in the shadows of the game's challenging Nightmare Mode. Featuring deadlier enemies, darker locations, and more terrifying surprises, each Nightmare Deck introduces new, alternate encounter cards and instructions for using them to reshape a scenario's encounter deck. The result? A nightmarish journey through territory you thought you knew, but with twists and turns that will have you on the edge of your seat!
189952.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: Trouble in Tharbad
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

189953.name: The Hackers Guild
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 73: Tuesday, October 4th
189953.description:
Do you have what it takes to accomplish the impossible?

The year is 2120 and the world’s population is still trying to overcome the devastation of the worldwide market crash of 2117. After a number of studies, it was revealed that corruption in government and the lack of unity among the government leaders caused the crash. As a result, a group of world leaders are now pushing for a single, worldwide government. Monolith Global Inc, an expert in cybernetics, has suggested that the government be run by robots, claiming that “It’s not possible for a robot to become corrupt, and as a result, they will always make the best decisions for the fate of mankind.”

However, a small number of people see this for what it really is – an attempt to enslave mankind. Known as the Hackers Guild, these rag tag freedom fighters are branded as criminals, and are living as fugitives from the law. All reasonable attempts to convince the powers that be that they are making a huge mistake have failed. The only option remaining appears to be the destruction of the program from the inside out. There is only one problem: hacking the company’s network is said to be impossible. Despite this, more and more of the common people are joining in the cause.

Time is running out for the guild as they strive to perform the impossible: hacking Monolith Global Inc and saving humanity from slavery.

The Hackers Guild is a cooperative game for 2-4 players ages 14 and up that plays in about 90 minutes. In the game, players take on the role of members of The Hackers Guild, and are trying to work together to find the three objective tools and complete the final hack against Monolith Global's data center. These tools are:

the Network Administrator's login credentials
malware used to bypass security and fire suppression systems
malware used to overheat the UPS' batteries causing a fire that will destroy the data center

Along the way, players will be able to add additional dice to their dice pool and purchase hacking tools that will make the hacks easier to accomplish.

Opposing the hackers is the Network Administrator AI whose sole objective is to track down the guild's hideout and send in the authorities to arrest the hackers, allowing Monolith Global to install their machines and enslave humankind.

189954.name: Nucleus GM Quick Start Guide (Version 5)
189954.description:
For Nucleus Version 5 and above

From the introduction:

This guide is meant to provide an overview of the core Nucleus rules and character creation for new Nucleus GMs. It is deliberately brief, for a more detailed overview see the full rules.

189955.name: Nucleus Roleplay System (Version 4)
189955.description:
From the introduction:

The Nucleus system has been designed to be a generic ruleset for any table top roleplay game or environment. Although it could be used on its own it has been designed to be supplemented by Add-ons that define a specific game world. What it gives you is a common framework in which all these game worlds can be played.

189956.name: System Shock 3
189956.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

System Shock 3 is the sequel to System Shock 2.

189957.name: Nucleus GM Quick Start Guide (Version 4)
189957.description:
For Version 3.3 and higher

From the introduction:

This guide is meant to provide an overview of the core Nucleus rules and character creation for new Nucleus GMs. It is delibratly brief, for more details see the full rule book.

User summary:

The "Version 4" release of this product supported the last few releases of the Version 3 rules (Versions 3.3, 3.4, and 3.5) as well as the release of the Version 4 rules.

189958.name: Nucleus Player Quick Start Guide (Version 4)
189958.description:
For Version 3.3 and higher

From the introduction:

This guide is meant to provide an overview of the core Nucleus rules and character creation for new players. It is
delibratly brief, for a more detailed overview see [the full rule book].

User summary:

The "Version 4" release of this product supported the last few releases of the Version 3 rules (Versions 3.3, 3.4, and 3.5) as well as the release of the Version 4 rules.

189959.name: Nucleus Character Generator (Version 4)
189959.description:
User summary:

The character generator supports the last few releases of Version 3 (3.3, 3.4, and 3.5) as well as the Version 4 release. It is implemented in Microsoft Excel as an XLS with data and formulas that partially automate and error-check the rather complicated character creation process.

The workbook has several tabs and cells are color-coded to indicate basic function (e.g., data entry, coded values, or derived values).

189960.name: Nucleus Accessories
189960.description:
User summary:

Nucleus had a wide variety of accessory items that were released in support of Version 4 and 5. Some of these items had incremental (minor) changes between the Versions, but some remained the same. The accessories included these items:


Character Sheet - a JPG file for print-and-play, to support general character creation (full color)
Psyonic Character Sheet - a JPG file for print-and-play, to support psionic characters for the Spacemaster Mod
Spell Sheet - a JPG file for print-and-play, to support spell-casting characters (full color)
Quick Reference Sheet - a PDF file with commonly-used tables
Attack Grid Templates - a PDF file with several hex grids for use during combat, focusing on larger targets
Mod Template - a 66-page Microsoft Word template for creating support files for sharing; "Mods" were genre packs for the basic game


Also see the separate item listings for the character generator Microsoft XLS Workbooks.

189961.name: Spacemaster Conversion
189961.description:
A Modification of Nucleus

User summary:

The product refers to itself variously as Spacemaster Conversion, Spacemaster Mod, or Space Master. It provides a science fiction genre setting ("Mod") for the Nucleus Modifiable Game System, focusing on space exploration.

189962.name: Gundam Breaker 3
189962.description:
User Summary

Gundam Breaker 3 is the sequel to Gundam Breaker 2.

189963.name: Gundam Breaker 2
189963.description:
User Summary

The general combat is much faster and more fluid than the previous game. Players can hold their melee weapons at the ready than just instantly spawn them when initiating a melee attack.

189964.name: D10/0 System Reference Document
189964.description:
From the introduction:

What makes this game system different that the others out there? Primarily, the individual components come together to allow a great degree of flexibility in character design while stemming off some of the confusion that can come from that flexibility. The various components interconnect with each other but without losing their separate definition. For example, Attributes influence Skills, but both still serve different functions on their own and are clearly defined. With well defined components, the game can be clearly tweaked and balanced to the preferences of a game designer.

189965.name: Saecula Mutata
189965.description:
From the introduction:

On a planet called Wiskedak (Wis-ke-dak), human civilization reached a fast paced technological enlightenment period. Knowledge and devices from this period are still not yet understood and almost seem like fanciful magic to the inhabitants now.

User summary:

The post-apocalyptic setting of Saecula Mutata is the primary setting for the D10/0 System game. Early in development it was referred to as Shattered Earth; this name was changed to distinguish it from other similar settings.

189966.name: GREB: Genetic Reject Employment Bureau
189966.description:
From the introduction:

The G.R.E.B. is a tabletop role-playing game where the players take on the roles of genetic rejects from the various genetic engineering projects of the future’s past, while they try to maintain something that could be misconstrued as employment. This task is never easy given a world that’s a disturbingly comedic parody of what everyone thought the future was supposed to be. The G.R.E.B. is a humor driven game where some of the wildest ideas are explored, expanded upon, exploited, and sometimes exterminated for the betterment of all.

189968.name: Mythos World: Horror Roleplaying
189968.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cosmic Horror Powered by the Apocalypse!

The universe is more terrifying than mankind can possibly imagine, but you've seen things, you know things, and you've begun to understand. Can you find a way to stop the evil always lurking in the shadows, waiting to enslave or destroy the human race? Can you survive with your sanity intact?

Mythos World is a roleplaying game of cosmic horror using the Apocalypse World engine. Players investigate bizarre events in a classic 1920s setting inspired by authors like H.P. Lovecraft, Clark Ashton Smith, Robert W. Chambers, and Robert E. Howard.

189969.name: Orange Quest
189969.description:
Orange Quest is a card game, based on comics "Orange Lif3" by Dmitry Dubrovin (Lemon5ky).

Players travel through varied locations, opening special cards with specific features. There they meet the bosses, players must work together to defeat them, playing cards with kicks, hooks, and so on.
Award for winning bosses - candies and useful cards. After defeating the boss, party begins, where players can fight each other.

The game ends after beating the final boss "Candy Joe". The winner is the player with the most candy.

189975.name: Aviary
189975.description:
Middle school can be a drag, but luckily your grade’s science teachers have decided to take the class on a field trip to the local aviary. You’ll finally get out of the classroom for a while, but it’s not all fun and games - you will be given assignments by the science teachers while you’re there. Will you buckle-down and observe the birds at the aviary, or will you try to ditch the class? Will you do your best to complete your teachers’ assignments, or will you be distracted by annoying pigeons who find their way into the aviary?

Aviary is a trick-taking card game in which 2-4 players take on the roles of middle school students on a class trip to an amazing open-air aviary to observe birds from around the world.

189977.name: Milvus-Class Fast Attack Craft
189977.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hundreds, if not thousands, of these cheap and versatile spaceships have been produced over the years. They are often used as workhorse spaceships for forces on a multitude of missions. These including space port and planetary security, trade route patrols, drug interdiction, search and rescue, and defence operations.

The Milvus is an ideal first spaceship for a party of adventurers. It is not overpowered, but it can survive challenging encounters. It is also uncomfortable and cramped enough to encourage players to go looking for something better, to go looking for adventure.

rpgseries: Southlands: Adventures Beneath the Pitiless Sun
189978.name: Tomb of Tiberesh
189978.description:
From publisher blurb:

What Lives in the Tomb?

Wondrous, Dangerous Things!

Tomb of Tiberesh is an adventure for the Southlands Campaign Setting for five or six 2nd-level characters and uses the 5th Edition rules. It is easily adapted to any fantasy desert campaign.

Just outside Per-Bastet, in the kingdom of Nuria Natal, lie the newly discovered remains of Anu-Asir, a city once believed to exist only in myth. The ruins of Anu-Asir lie submerged under accumulations of sand, floodwater, and tall tales. It is now a hub of activity for those seeking to uncover its secrets—and profit from them. Droves of the curious, hopeful, greedy, and eccentric congregate around the unearthed city.

And just outside Anu-Asir, across the River Nuria, lies the most recently surfaced relic: the Pyramid of Tiberesh. Dare you explore its deadly mysteries?

189979.name: Advent of the Avalanche Lords
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
189979.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Level 3 Adventure

A showdown at the icy gates of civilization! Father Frost has gone missing and Krinnleton faces explosive turmoil from within. A band of newly-arrived adventurers offer hope that the nefarious forces from the north may be routed. But the magical dome around the elven town crumbles and the might of the vile Avalanche Lords strengthens! The heroes must survive their journey through the icy wastes, past the hideous shiver serpents, beyond the edge of the snowy peaks to the old woodman's lava-drenched workshop. Only then might they defeat the marching mammoths wielding the pulsating polar energy of the terrible Celsion Engine!

189980.name: Advanced Androids
189980.description:
From publisher blurb:

Circuits and Wire with a Beating Heart

Mysterious technology so advanced, many think it is magical. Androids know not their true origins, but make their own way in a primitive world of gods and magic despite being creatures of science and electronics. Play this race from the stars and show the world your true mettle.

Book of Heroic Races: Advanced Androids is the essential guide for playing an android character. This 23-page supplement features:

Racial Traits to play an android, 5 alternate racial traits, and 2 new character traits to customize your character for this unique play experience
9 New Character Class Options, including the nanoshade ninja archetype, the wiremind cryptic archetype, 2 new rogue talents, and a new barbarian rage power
7 New Feats, including several that increase the power of your nanites
5 New Magic and Mundane Items and 4 New Spells
A New Philosophy, which provides its followers a robotic view of birth, life, and death
Details on android adventurers as well as suggestions on how to incorporate this race into your world.

189981.name: Psi-punk: World's Edge Arena
189981.description:
From publisher blurb:

Old Meets New

In the southernmost city in the world, thousands of people come and brave the unforgiving weather to watch the World’s Edge Arena, a televised bloodsport for the modern era. Thanks to the Arena’s success, the once-quiet town of Punta Arenas is now an industrious boomtown where warriors compete for prize money, entrepreneurs compete for a share of the tourism, and locals compete for the scraps of what’s left.

Have you come seeking fame and fortune at the risk of finding an early grave, or are you an old-timer who wants to see the city returned to its old ways? Whether you’re here to compete or you’re just trying to eke out a living in this rapidly changing city, one thing’s for certain: your life will never be the same thanks to the World’s Edge Arena.

This book includes:

A detailed look at the city of Punta Arenas, Chile, in the year 2096. A look at its interesting places, people, night life, and other features which make the city a prime place to set a campaign.
Guidelines for running an Arena tournament using Psi-punk. Characters battle in ever-shifting terrain against all manner of beasts and warriors.
A new “Fan Favor” mechanic for players to earn bonuses by wooing crowds and earning fan loyalty.
New statblocks for over two dozen opponents, including psychically-controlled, cybernetically enhanced beasts such as kodiak bears and komodo dragons. Plenty of human opponents for use in any Psi-punk game.
Sample background hooks for new character archetypes such as the Beast Trainer, Controller, Promoter, Street Rat, and Security guard.
6 new adventure seeds set in and around the city of Punta Arenas. Inspiration for Game Masters who’d like to craft non-combat encounters.

189982.name: Ring of Fire
189982.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grand Stair stretches behind the scenes of the multiverse,
The Doors upon its unfathomably vast span leading the way to gossamer worlds of limitless variety and infinite possibility. Some worlds last forever. Some worlds burn.

Ring of Fire is a ring-world that once provided living space for millions of species on a miraculous hoop encircling a shining star, until the day an evil force turned the sun into a weapon and doomed most of the world to the harsh glare of eternal high noon. Nowadays, a line of scorching sunlight encroaches mile by mile, and the only way to stay alive is to march westward across the frontier. The Walking West is an ever-trudging land of gunslingers and golems, preachers and pilgrims, steam-craft and survival. Head west, my sons, and know that while all the world marches with you, death marches behind you.

189983.name: Universal Adventures Adventure Module DD1: The Dungeons of Karas Karn
189983.description:
From publisher blurb:

Search for the legendary Hammer of Karakus within the Dungeons of Karas Karn!

Last wielded by the human paladin, Talon Darkbane, the legendary Hammer of Karakus was thought forever lost. Then you discovered the remains of a journal kept by a cleric that traveled with Talon and clues to the weapon's final resting place were revealed – Karakus went home. The famed paladin and the legendary hammer had entered the fallen dwarf hold, Karas Karn. Neither were seen again. Now you and your comrades, armed with the pages from the cleric’s journal, can trace the paladin’s steps and discover what lay within The Dungeons of Karas Karn.

The Dungeons of Karas Karn is the first in a new series of dungeon adventures from New Realms Publishing. The adventure takes the characters into the depths of a fallen dwarf hold in search of a legendary magic hammer. But beware, for it is unlikely that the hold is uninhabited and if Darkbane met his end there, whatever finished him may still be about. Delve into the dark depths, battle the deadly inhabitants, overcome the dangerous traps and seek a legendary weapon within The Dungeons of Karas Karn.

The Adventure Module includes a new Adventure Record, 9 Adventure cards, 9 Encounter cards, 9 Event cards, 9 Search cards and 18 Treasure cards. In addition, to capture the old school dungeon feel we’ve included several areas that are detailed in Custom Encounters and Custom Encounters II. If you want to add more variety, strange events and encounters, you can expand on these adventure areas with cards from Custom Encounters and Custom Encounters II.

The Dungeons of Karas Karn takes the characters on an old school, dark and deadly dungeon delve, full of dangerous foes, strange sites and fabulous treasure. Suitable for use with any fantasy role playing game, The Dungeons of Karas Karn can be played solo or with a group, with or without a GM. The adventure is highly re-playable and compatible with other Universal Adventures cards. In addition, you can combine the cards with other cards from the series, or cards from other Universal Adventures products, to create your own adventures.

The Adventure Module is a new, simple way to play fantasy adventures. The organization and presentation of the adventures allows for quick setup, quick play and gives you the ability to focus on the action and “story” while leaving you the option to include tactical action and combat if you desire. Enter a new and exciting world of adventure, full of wonder and surprises. Enter The Dungeons of Karas Karn, if you dare!

189984.name: Savage Lairs: Fantasy Forests
189984.description:
From publisher blurb:

“You want to go where?!”

Players are an unpredictable lot. You spend hours planning the perfect adventures, then they ignore your carefully staged clues to head off in a direction you had not prepared. Savage Lairs is here to help.

This book presents a range of sixty encounters all tailored to fit within a typical fantasy forest. Each page presents a new scene that offers a way to occupy the players while you try to figure out how to adapt your masterwork to their unexpected actions. Some could lead to a side quest or an unrelated adventure, but this is not necessary. These encounters help you to occupy the heroes for a bit, while you hurriedly readjust your main focus.

Savage Lairs Fantasy Forests is for use with any fantasy setting.

189985.name: Blackout
189985.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure in a world of 1930s noirpunk—a sepia-toned, neon-lit, art-deco cityscape ravaged by the Industrial Revolution and the soul-crushing horrors of the Great War—not to mention a subtle invasion by a malignant alien intelligence!

The Blackout setting exists on an alternate Earth, where Europe was virtually destroyed in the Great War of 1914 to 1918, and the United States was reduced to competing city-states separated by vast tracts of wasteland. The common folk have largely lost faith in technological advances, not the least because an alien entity now occupying the planet's ionosphere occasionally brings electrical devices to malevolent life!

Players take role of government Snuff Squad agents sent to hunt down these rogue machines, even using their own powers against them.

189986.name: BostonCrawl
189986.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bang out and ship up to Boston!

Ladies and gentleman, it’s the game that turns brass dragons green with envy, Maximum Xcrawl! Powered by the mighty Pathfinder gaming engine, Xcrawl is where dungeon hack and slash goes prime time and sells advertising space on the cooling corpses of your enemies.

The BostonCrawl is the first full-lethal event of its kind to be held in Beantown, and the locals are taking it very seriously. Get ready for DJ Molly Militia's undead redcoats, the Hockey Stick of Doom, and a creature that is equal parts devastatingly dangerous and wicked refreshing – the beer golem!

189987.name: Vater der Dunkelheiten
189987.description:
A short Adventure in the Sprudelhof. Created for an rpg event in Bad Nauheim, Germany.
In order to offer something very special a very unique adventure for the rpg Chtulhu has been written and it never playes anywhere else than in the Sprudelhof.

Ein kurzes Abenteuer im Sprudelhof anlässlich "Bad Nauheim spielt!"
Um der Veranstaltung etwas ganz Besonderes zu bieten, wurde nun ein ganz eigenes Abenteuer für das Rollenspiel Chtulhu geschrieben, das nirgends anders spielt - als am Sprudelhof.

189988.name: Der Dunkle Fürst
189988.description:
Irgendetwas Böses regt sich. Menschen verschwinden und es geht das Gerücht um, dass irgendwer die uralten Grabkammern geöffnet hat. Kehrt der Dunkle Fürst zurück?
Dies ist der Sammelband der drei Soloabenteuer zur Reihe "Der Dunkle Fürst".

Something evil is rising. People disappear and the rumor sperads that somebody has opened the ancient tombs. Will the dark lord return?
This is the collection of all three adventure books from the series "Der Dunkle Fürst".

189989.name: One Arm Bandit
189989.description:
One Arm Bandit is based on the concept of a slot machine. Players pay a silver dollar for the privilege of selecting a red, yellow, or blue tile which they hope will complete a combination that pays off according to the House Odds chart.

After cashing in a winning combination, a player selects three new tiles and continues the search for another combination. If a player runs out of cash before putting together a winning combination, he pans out and is out of the game.

Certain combinations with Jackpot tiles are more valuable than others, earning the holder additional silver dollars from the Bar.

The player with the most money at the end of the game is the winner.

189990.name: Resident Evil: Origins Collection
189990.description:
User Summary

Comes with HD remasters of Resident Evil and Resident Evil 0.

189991.name: Just Another Day
189991.description:
User summary:

Just Another Day is set in the cyberpunk genre. Characters have five Attributes (Agile, Brain, Charm, Detect, Endure) and a "Mod" which is a cybernetic implant. The game master is called the Operator and the characters are called Mod Runners. Opposed action rolls are made with a modified D10 compared against a difficulty target.

189992.name: Campaign Chunks Volume Eight
189992.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Campaign Chunk is an item, place or something else that can fit into any campaign or story with little or no modification, although some will be more suited to certain genres than others.

They have few stats and can help provide starting grounds for adventures or help fill in the gaps when your players go off exploring and you need something for them to do. Each has several hooks or rumour that can be used. Which of these are true and which are false?

Originally first published on the blog/website of Ennead Games, these Chunks have been compiled into a handy volume. Their details may have been cleaned up and more hooks or rumours added to them, but they basically the same.

Contents:

Book of the Dead - An ancient Egyptian funerary text.
Farbrough Penal Colony - A remote island prison that can only be accessed by a 30 minutes boat ride.
Fig Plants - This chunk is all about a soft, sweet fruit.
Grand Tour - A grueling bike race across varied terrain.
Hoodening - An odd tradition where someone is on a hobby-horse and has a cloth made from old sacks placed over them.
International Space Authority - An organisation to help prevent clashes and to oversee international co-operation.
Solaris, the solar powered town - Solaris is a home for testing new or improved design in energy production.
Vertigo City - A large city within a city.
“What if?” Magazine - “What if?” is a speculative fiction magazine.
Young Explorers - Many countries have some kind of organisation that supports young people in their physical, mental and spiritual development.

189993.name: 21XX: Fall of the Masters
189993.description:
User summary:

In 21XX: Fall of the Masters the game master is called the Evil Scientist and his non-player characters are either Masters or Minions. Players control members of a Squad of Robots who fight the Masters. Action resolution uses D6 rolls. While Robots do have basic Attributes most of the game's variability comes from equipment loadout of weapons.

189994.name: Fineous Frost
189994.description:
From publisher blurb:

He spent decades on ice, and he has no plans to go back… Fineous Frost!

A Power Level 10 Rogue, Fineous Frost is a man with a lifetime of criminal experience. Fineous Frost is an iconic character in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Fineous Frost's file is designated "Gold" to denote that his powers are the result of external manipulation of some kind. Exactly what kind of chemical cocktail is responsible for his transformation remains a closely guarded secret, but his ability to create and manipulate areas of intense cold are a chilling experience for anyone who would stand in his way. To the world at large, Frost is a reformed ex-convict, setting up a business in the heroes’s home town. In secret, Frost is a more careful criminal, operating from behind the scenes, and he plays well against heroic detectives who are diligent enough to untangle his criminal web to discover the spider at the center. He would also certainly hold a grudge against heroes who carry the legacies of other heroes he faced in his earlier career, before he spent decades years in prison. Or, if one of your heroes is an immortal himself, Frost may be a “blast from the past” to represent the never-ending fight against crime!

189995.name: The Huntsman's Isle
189995.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for novice characters

By legendary designer, Skip Williams, this challenging adventure takes groups to the brink of madness as they explore the ruins of a haunted castle and its environs. A site-based scenario loaded with deadly challenges and nasty foes, groups have thei work cut out for them if they would take on the Huntsman!

189996.name: Egypt
189996.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ancient Adversaries Awaken!

Mythic Monsters: Egypt contains an assortment of amazing adversaries for your heroes, ranging from CR 4 to 17, starting with a squadron of sphinxes to confront your adventuring heroes from the hungry hunting hieracosphinx to the crass but clever criosphinx and the proud and noble androsphinx. Not all Egyptian monsters are adversaries, as honorable characters may find allies in the winged maftet and the wise two-headed uraeus. Others are every inch a menace, from hateful werecrocodilesand sinister sha and sacred sha carrying plagues in their wake to deadly scavenging scarab swarms and giant scarabs. Of course, much of the Egyptian legendarium in popular and fantasy culture centers around tombs and ruins, and mummies are far from the only inhabitants of the necropolis, as elemental ahkhats are literally a part of the buildings they guard, while mummified cursed kings and eternally vigilant pharaonic guardians guard their domains with jealous and zealous care. As if a dozen existing monsters were not enough, the vicious corpse-eating ammuts sit in judgment on the dead and the damned. For heroes that want to embody that Egyptian vibe for themselves, this book also provides a mythic version of the treasure-hunting archaeologist bard and the legendary living monolith prestige class, anointed with a sacred stone by the ancient sphinx to serve as guardians extraordinaire.

189997.name: Scenario Upgrade Pack: In the Shadows
189997.description:
From publisher blurb:

In The Shadows (CHA2357) is a Call of Cthulhu scenario collection published by Chaosium (in print and PDF), released in 1995. This pack, created as an independent add-on by Cthulhu Reborn, upgrades the three scenarios from the Chaosium book by providing them with fresh renditions of their numerous player handouts (some of which are hard to read in the original publication due to printing errors).

Handouts in this collection are presented in high-quality form in full colour (for use as deluxe player props), and also provided as text-only handouts (for speedy access to clues). The upgrade pack also contains notes to make it easier to run these scenarios with the latest (7th) edition of Chaosium's Call of Cthulhu rules.

The three classic scenarios documented in these dire artefacts of doom are: Devil's Hole, In The Shadows of Death, and Song of the Spheres. They were all written by Gary Sumpter, who has also approved these new enhancements to his original creation.

IMPORTANT NOTE: This PDF is not a stand-alone product, but relies on having access to the Chaosium publication In The Shadows (CHA2357).

189998.name: Island of Ignorance: The Third Cthulhu Companion - Player Handouts for Scenarios
189998.description:
From publisher blurb:

Island of Ignorance: The Third Cthulhu Companion is a Call of Cthulhu sourcebook and scenario collection published by Golden Goblin Press (in print and PDF). Cthulhu Reborn, in conjunction with Golden Goblin, are pleased to release this deluxe edition of the props/handouts that pertain to the five scenarios found in Island of Ignorance.

Handouts in this collection are presented in high-quality form in full colour, enhancing the black & white versions found in the Golden Goblin book. Furthermore the versions found in this collection have a higher resolution and are presented in two versions -- one with full textures and effects, the other plain to facilitate their printing on specialty paper.

The five scenarios documented in these dire artefacts of doom are: Consumption by Brian M. Sammons, The Lonely Point Lighthouse by Oscar Rios, Let the Children Come to Me by Mark Shireman, With Blue Uncertain Stumbling by Jeff Moeller, and Darkness Illuminated by Jon Hook

Download this pack to enhance your Island of Ignorance game experience with the addition of an evocative collection of prop documents.

189999.name: Crystal Catacombs
189999.description:
Crystal Catacombs is a challenging, retro inspired “Megavanian” love letter that utilizes Roguelike procedurally generated levels/enemies/items with a heavy emphasis on classic 2D platforming.

Discover, equip, use, and master an assortment of varied weapons, magic spells and upgrades.

Source: The Publisher Website.

190000.name: Jovian Despair
190000.description:
From the introduction:

Players play the crew of a transport ship charged with moving goods and supplies between the Jovian lunar colonies. As the campaign progresses, interlunar politics and desperation make way for deteriorating technology, starvation, and social collapse.

User summary:

Received "Honorable Mention" in the Two-Page Tabletop Competition.
